loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 61 years old.  She is married and has one child. She works very hard to provide for them. Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Victoria has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar, shampoo, noodles, etc,.  In the future Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ernawati

texts.en:
Ibu (Mrs.) Ernawati owns the shop and she shares the burden with her husband. Most of the time, you can also find Ibu Ernawati’s husband standing by in the shop because his works depends on orders. Ibu Ernawati and her husband have only one child. Their child is 32 months old.

The reason why Ibu Ernawati wants to be a Loket Ruma agent is because in their neighborhood, it’s rare to find a payment point for electricity that prints a receipt every time the customer buys the electricity products from Indonesia's electricity company called PLN. Other than that, with the EDC machine that they will have, Ibu Ernawati and her husband will also be able to buy electricity vouchers, house installments, and motorcycle installments.

In the long run, this will not only generate more income for the family, but Ibu Ernawati hopes that the business will be sustained and will be able to serve more people in the neighborhood.

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for her bill payment business

loans.name: Stefanus Ayung Alam

texts.en:
Stefanus Ayung owns a shop that sells drinks, food, snacks, home equipment and Ruma's prepaid airtime minutes. However, people around his neighborhood call him Bapak Ayung for short. He runs this business along with his wife, but he is the one who most often serves the customers. 
  
With this upcoming electronic data capture machine (EDC), he expects not only to reduce the churn of customers, but also to attract new customers to come to the shop. He hopes that he can facilitate all payments and people will come and find him to pay.

Bapak Ayung and his wife have one child, age 2 years old. Like any other entrepreneur, he knows that by expanding his business, he will eventually earn more money for his family

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 57 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy, Zambonaga del Norte. She is married and has five children.

Lily works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase boxes of fish to sell.

Lily has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Asliddin

texts.ru: Аслиддин проживает в городе Душанбе. Он женат. Ему 28 лет. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Аслиддин занимается развозкой пассажиров по установленному маршруту. Он берет кредит для ремонта своей машины.
texts.en: Asliddin lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 28 years old and married. While his wife takes care of the household, Asliddin works by transporting passengers along a fixed route. He is taking this loan to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his Tangem shuttle bus

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 18 years old and single with no children. She plans to start a business selling general goods and products like clothes, handicrafts, etc. at her flea market. She has requested a loan to purchase goods and equipment to start up her new business. 

Annie will use her profits to further improve her business and bring good quality. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her flea market such as traditional jewellery sets, lavalavas, crafted bowls/houses/frames, and tapa cloth

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, a 31-year-old mother of one dependent daughter, is a farmer and seamstress to earn more income for her family's sake. She has been with these businesses for two years and is able to earn a daily income of about 38,000 KHR. Mom has received a loan with VisionFund three times. She has managed the loans successfully and completely paid back already. 

The loans have helped her to lease a small stall in the market for running her tailor shop and maintain her rice farming business. As the leader of a group loan consisting of three members, she is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR; one of her group member is also applying for 1,000,000 KHR while  the other one is seeking 300,000 KHR. Mom will use her portion to buy seeds plus plowing the field and buying fabric for her tailor shop.

loans.use: To buy seeds plus plowing the field and buying fabric for her tailor shop.

loans.name: Phlonh

texts.en:
Phlonh, 35 years old, resides in Siem Reap province where she and her spouse raise two school-aged children. Shown in the photo with her husband, Phlonh is in the business of farming and pig-raising to help her husband earn household income. Her earnings go toward daily food and allowances for her children, while her husband's income is kept for future business growth and family emergencies. Her husband is a construction laborer who also devotes his free time to help manage their rice-farming business.

Phlonh, who works hard and wants to attain more income in the future, is requesting a loan of KHR 400,000 to purchase a plowing machine for the maintenance of the rice field. Also, a portion of the funds will purchase feeds for fattening the pigs. She believes that this precious loan will result in a good return for the family, allowing her to continue her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine for the maintenance of the rice field.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 50 years old.  She is married and has 4 children. Wilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready-to-wear retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Wilma has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ready-to-wear retail for 6 years and also earns an income from livestock. Wilma aspires to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her fishing business.

Alona has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from charcoal retailing.

Alona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for fishing

loans.name: Mario's Group

texts.en:
Mario is 60 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  He is widowed with three children.  Mario has a single motor for hire business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to be used in purchasing spare motorcycle parts for repalcement.
 
Mario has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Mario hopes to engage in other types of business. Mario is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase spare motorcycle parts for replacement

loans.name: Elena's Group

texts.en:
Elena is forty-six years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. Elena has a general store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to be used to purchase additional groceries for sale.

Elena has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Elena hopes to expand her business. Elena is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for sale.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Sum is 43 years old and is a married mother of six children, residing in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She devotes herself to farming while her husband provides a horse transportation service for household income. Together, they can make around USD 8.00 per day to support themselves. Sum wants to be more successful in her family-owned businesses and earn a good income to meet her daily living needs. Besides transportation business, Sum's husband is going to get involved in trading firewood, but, due to the lack of capital, he will have difficulties to get access to this new business. To help her husband in the business and deal with the problems, Sum decided to look for a loan in the sum of USD 1,200 to purchase an additional horse and firewood stocks. Sum believes that, through the new business, the household will increase its income to satisfy her family needs. Also, she will save it for her children’s education and future emergencies of the family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional horse and firewood stocks for her husband's new business.

loans.name: Uulbek

texts.ru:
Уулбек  39 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. 3 года назад, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Уулбек  с 10,000 сом начала свой бизнес в торговле аксессуарами для сотовых телефонов и предоставлении услуг по загрузке оплаты за связь.  Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Уулбек сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уулбек обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Уулбек планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Uulbek is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children. Three years ago, while looking for a source of income for her family, Uulbek used 10,000 som to launch her business that sells mobile phone accessories and facilitates payment for telephone services. Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Uulbek's business grew and currently brings her 8,000 som (KGS) per month.

In order to continue developing her business, Uulbek has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to expand the assortment of her merchandise. She plans to invest her profits into expanding her retail outlet as well as into repairing her home.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of her merchandise

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
This is Mamerta. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy vinegar and charcoal to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of vinegar, charcoal, gas containers and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mamerta hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase such items as charcoal and vinegar for retail sale in her shop

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 41 years old and married with 10 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and is requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Belinda has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail business for 18 years and also earns an income from vegetable retailing.

Belinda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy and sell charcoal

loans.name: La Ace

texts.en:
La Ace is a 40 year old widower.  He has four children from his marriage and they are Sultan who is 12 and attends elementary school grade six, Fajri who is nine and attends elementary school grade four, Farhat who is six and will enter elementary school grade one and Satia who is nine months old. 

La Ace is a fisherman.  He has a boat and usually goes fishing every week.  He admits that the income generated from being a fisherman is sufficient but it is unstable when the weather is bad.  

Recently, La Ace used his business capital to pay for his children’s schooling due to the start of the new school year.  Therefore, he needs additional capital to support his operating costs including fuel, meals, water and small fish to be used for bait.  Therefore, La Ace is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 IDR from TLM.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to improve both his family life and his business.

loans.use: to pay for fuel, meals, water and small fish to be used for bait.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 60 years old and single. 

Loreta runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. Loreta has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, spices, and snack foods.

In the future Loreta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Hajra's Group

texts.en:
Hajra has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her son’s water tank selling business. These tanks are used by people to store water at their homes. With the loan investment he will buy water tanks to resell at a profit. He is an experienced person in his business and has been operating it for the past many years. Hajra is confident that the loan will help him making his business more profitable.

She is a housewife, remaining at home and doing her household responsibilities.  She has two other sons. One of them works in a factory while the youngest one is studying.

Hajra is very hard-working lady and has raised her children with great care. She is confident about her son’s business success as a result of loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Hajra.

loans.use: To buy water tanks for a water tank sales business

loans.name: Marisol De La Cruz

texts.es: Marisol de la cruz de 42 años de edad soltera, con cuatro hijos, esta emprendedora se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajadora, de buenas costumbres, tiene por actividad economica una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, esta herramienta de trabajo la inicio como una necesidad de obtener un ingreso para mantener a sus 4 hijos, ya que su esposo fallecio hace 10 años que en aquel entonces dependian 100% de el . en la actulidad ha podido superar muchas prueba por su tenacidad y responsabilidad, y con mucho esfuerzo ha visto superarse a sus hijos dando la educacion necesaria, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar productos de consumo diario como: arroz, frijoles, azucar, aceite, pan, harina, huevos, leche, entre otros.
texts.en: Marisol De La Cruz is 42 years old, she is single and she has four children. This entrepreneur is a responsible and hard-working person with good values. She runs a grocery store located in her house, a working activity she started 10 years ago after the death of her husband, whom they totally depended on, as she needed to have a source of income to provide for her 4 children. She has succeeded in overcoming many difficulties thanks to her tenacity and responsibility, and she has seen her children progress thanks to the necessary education she has provided them with through her many efforts. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy daily consumers’ goods such as rice, oil, bread, eggs, milk and other products.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, bread, eggs and milk.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making and selling firewood in the Philippines.

Lucia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood for her business.

She has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for her business.

loans.name: Jaanbubu

texts.ru:
Жаанбубу 57 лет. Жаанбубу в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 8,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Жаанбубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  4 коровы с приплодом, 10 овец, продажа молока приносит около 10,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жаанбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Жаанбубу будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Jaanbubu is 57 years old. As the main source of income for her family, for the past 20 years she has been raising livestock and growing crops, having started her business with a sum of 8,000 som. Thanks to Jaanbubu's hard work, her herd currently includes 4 cows with offspring and 10 sheep, while sales of milk bring roughly 10,000 som per month.

In order to continue expanding her business, Jaanbubu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Aliyakan

texts.ru:
Алиякан 63 года, вдова, воспитала 9 детей. Алиякан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 25 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 400 советских рублей. Благодаря упорному труду Алиякан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 коровы с приплодом, 15 овец, 2 лошади, продажа молока приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алиякан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Алиякан планирует вложить в закуп скота для развития бизнеса младшего сына.
texts.en:
Aliyakan is a 63-year-old widow who has raised 9 children. As the main source of income for her family, Aliyakan has been raising livestock and growing crops for the past 25 years, having started her business with a sum of 400 Soviet rubles. Thanks to her hard work, Aliyakan's herd currently includes 2 cows with offspring, 15 sheep and 2 horses, while sales of milk bring roughly 15,000 som per month.

In order to continue developing her business, Aliyakan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into her youngest son's business by buying livestock for him.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: El's Group

texts.en:
A local villager of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, El is a 32-year-old widower. He makes his living through farming rice on two hectares of farmland, and sometimes he works for others for a fee. He has been in this business for ten years, earning about 6,000KHR per day. A lack of working capital is still a main challenge for his business. 

El is is in his second cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, while the other two are first-time borrowers. He has successfully used the first loan and he fixed his house for living. After the first loan, he is leading his group of three members to apply for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his rice farming. With this loan, he hopes to grow his rice healthfully and make more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his rice farming

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 59 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Eden has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Eden aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lalin's Group

texts.en:
Lalin, 37, is married with two children, who are dependents and still in school. She is a grocery seller in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang district selling fried noodle, cake, and soft drinks while her husband is a local electronic mechanic. She has been in the business for several years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day to use for expenses. 

This is the first loan for Lalin’s group of five members who live in the same village. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items for her store. She hopes to expand her business and earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net and gasoline for her fishing business.

Ellen has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Ellen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 32 years old and married with three children.

Cristita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Cristita has been farming vegetables for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sinoeurn

texts.en: Sinoeurn, 38, lives in one of the remote areas of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She has four dependent children, two daughters and two sons, who work at a garment factory. To support this big family, she and her husband have been farming on one hectare of farmland as their main source of income. To better feed the family, they also plant water convolvulus and yardlong beans. She has been with both businesses for 15 years, and she is able to save only $2 per day. The main challenge for her family is the declining price of vegetables. This is the second loan for Sinoeurn. She has used her first loan successfully in improving her living condition. She is now requesting a loan with VisionFund to buy a cow for raising and a motorbike for transporting her cash crops to the market. She hopes that she will have many calves to help with future needs in plowing and earning more income from both businesses.

loans.use: To buy a cow for raising and a motorbike for transporting her cash crops to the market

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Carla del Socorro, es  comerciante  del  mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega desde hace 20 años, vende desayuno y almuerzo desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres y media de la tarde de lunes a domingo.
Trabaja con la Ceprodel desde hace 6 años con 36 créditos, financiamientos que le han ayudado a incrementar su negocio, y sus utilidades y con estas mejorar su calidad de vida, con mejoras de vivienda y de su propio negocio
 Le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar.  Tiene una hija en edad escolar y por la que lucha para sacarla adelante, Solicita el  préstamo para la compra de  granos básicos al por mayor  para su negocio, Se siente agradecida con Ceprodel, por la confianza depositada en ella con los préstamos  que le hemos brindado.
texts.en:
Carla del Socorro, who has been a shopkeeper in the Santa Ana de Chinandega market for 20 years, sells breakfast and lunch from 6:00 in the morning until 3:30 in the afternoon Monday through Sunday.

She has worked with Ceprodel for six years with 36 loans, financing that has helped her to increase her business and her profits and with these profits to better her quality of life, with home improvements and improvements to her business.  It has allowed her to sustain her home.  She has a school-age child and for her she struggles to get ahead.  

She is asking for a loan to buy basic grains at wholesale for her business.  She feels grateful to Ceprodel for the confidence placed in her with the loans that they have provided her.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Otajon

texts.ru: Отачон житель района Гиссар. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Отачон предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для установки оборудования для природного газа.
texts.en: Otajon lives in the Gissar region. He is 41 years old, married, and has five children. Otajon's wife takes care of the household, while he has been providing taxi services for the past two years. Otajon is taking this loan to convert his car to use natural gas.

loans.use: to convert his car to use natural gas

loans.name: Sveta

texts.ru:
Свете 49 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Света в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 17 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Светы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 коровы с приплодом, 10 овец, 3 лошади, продажа молока приносит около 6,000 сом в месяц. Также, Света обрабатывает 1,95 га земли, где выращивает пшеницу и эспарцет. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Света обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Света планирует вложить в ремонт дома для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Sveta is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children. As the main source of income for her family, Sveta has been raising livestock and growing crops for the past 17 years, having launched her business with a sum of 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Sveta's herd currently includes 2 cows with offspring, 10 sheep and 3 horses, while sales of milk bring roughly 6,000 som per month. Sveta also works 1.95 hectares of land where she grows wheat and sainfoin.

In order to continue developing her business, Sveta has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy additional livestock. She plans to use her profits from this loan to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rik

texts.en:
This is Rik’s fourth loan that will enable her to make improvements in her farming business.  She will use the requested loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides and pay for operating expenses. As for the previous three loans, Rik said that they helped her to provide food, allowances and basic needs to her family very well. 

Rik is 57 years old, married, and a mother of four children, two among whom are already married. Presently she lives with her husband and some of her children in Siem Reap province. 

She hopes that lenders will give her constant support, thus she will be able to grow her business as well as her household income. She desires to send her two children to a good university after they finish their studies at high school level.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides and pay for operating expenses.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy materials and equipment needed for her fishing business.

Josephine has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials and equipment needed for fishing

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is a married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has three young children. Her eldest is six years old and her youngest is only 9 months old. Her husband is a painter and while he works, Araceli attends to her small sari-sari store (general store). She also buys and sells dried fish in her community. 

She is asking   for a loan to buy a supply of dried fish, snack food, noodles, canned goods, detergent and seasoning. Araceli is hopeful that she can continue her business and improve it so she can better support her children as they grow older. She hopes that someday she can send them to school for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a supply of dried fish, snack food, noodles, canned goods, detergent and seasoning

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a "trisikad" transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her "trisikad" transport business.

NWTF is relisting Emilia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her "trisikad" transport.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Leonita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns some additional income from pig fattening. Leonita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Leonita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to have a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Thach's Group

texts.en:
The bread-winner of a big family, Thach is 61 and a widow. She has seven children. Three of her children are dependent and work to make a living. To earn a living, she has been farming rice and selling vegetables for thirty-three years. As a farmer, the main challenge for her business is the low crop yields. 

This is Thach’s group of five members, who are all females. She has completed six loans with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she has completely paid them back. The loans have helped to relieve her family’s burden and improve her family’s livelihood. Now, she can earn about 49,000 KHR per day. She is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farm and use a portion of it to buy more vegetables to sell. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business and make more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farm

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas y tiene 60 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 5 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 7 años, y es dueña de un vehículo con el cual ha empezó una empresa de transportes de pasajeros que ella administra. Ella dice que gracias a FINCA Perú logró construir su casa, ya que le brindan facilidades de préstamo, también le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Banco Comunal donde aprende mucho intercambiando experiencias con las demás socias El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y en el mantenimiento de su vehículo.
texts.en: Zenaida is a member of Azucenas (White Lilies) Communal Bank, she is 60 years old, she is a widow and she has 5 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 7 years, and she owns a car with which she has started a passengers transportation company that she manages. She says that thanks to FINCA Peru she has succeeded in having her house built, because of the good terms of the loans they grant her; she also likes attending the meetings of her Communal Bank where she learns a lot by exchanging experiences with the other members. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy tyres and to pay for the maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.use: To buy tyres and to pay for the maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Emerlyn

texts.en:
Emerlyn is 31 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell.

Emerlyn has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading and selling "copra" (dried coconut meat).

Emerlyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Thorm's Group

texts.en: Thorm is 53 years old living in a village of Mongkul Borey district of Cambodia. She is a married mother of one child. She manages her household via chicken raising and working for others for pay. She has been in these businesses for two years which enables her to earn about 18,000 KHR per day. For her, insufficiency of working capital is the main challenges for her family. Therefore, she has formed a group with another female member to request a loan of 600,000 KHR each. This is the first loan for Thorm. As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy chicken feeds and materials for building a chicken coop. She hopes to earn more profit from her current business so that she is able to not only buy a plot of farmland for growing paddy rice but also make a better living.

loans.use: To buy chicken feeds and build a chicken coop

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Yves Robert

texts.fr: Yves Robert est un jeune homme agée de 33 ans, célibataire père d'un enfant de 4 ans qui va déjà à l'école. Il a un petit secrétariat dans un quartier de la capitale, sa clientèle devient de plus en plus nombreuse alors elle sollicite un crédit pour agrandir sa structure en ajoutant un ordinateur et une imprimante couleur pour pouvoir la satisfaire et augmenter sa production. Il réinvestira une partie les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt dans son activité en achetant d'autres machines et petit matériel bureautique, et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Yves Robert is a young man of 33, single and the father of a child of four who already attends school. He has a little secretarial office in a district of the capital. His clientele is becoming more and more numerous so he is requesting a loan to grow his business by buying an additional computer and a color printer so that he can satisfy his clientele and increase his output. 

He will reinvest a part of the profit he makes based on this loan in his business, buying other machines and office supplies, and the remainder will be helpful in supporting his little family.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a color printer

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
This is Trinidad. She previously took out a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Trinidad hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has an egg selling business in the Philippines.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of eggs to sell to her customers.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of eggs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby is a 36-year-old fisherman living in Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. He has been a fisherman for 12 years. Bobby joined CEVI to gain access to financial services. He is applying for a loan worth 3,000 PHP which he will use to buy materials for fishing such as nets and ropes. With them, he will be able to increase his daily catch.
Bobby works hard to support his family and his two young children, who are six and four years old. 
In the future, Bobby hopes to expand his fishing business and buy a new fishing boat so that he can increase his earnings. Bobby adds that he wants to give his best for the welfare of the family especially for his children. He wants to reinvest so that he can pay for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing such as nets and ropes.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 41 years old and married with two children.

Marissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Marissa has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for seven years and also earns an income farming rice.

Marissa hopes to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a decorations business in the Philippines.

Fausta has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy starfish to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Fausta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy starfish to sell.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase sewing supplies for her business.

NWTF is relisting Hilaria's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rath's Group

texts.en:
Rath is 55 years old and lives in a rural village of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province. She has six children, who are all dependents. Only three of them are now in school while the other three are under school age. The family’s sources of income are from planting red maize and raising pigs in their backyard. She and her husband have been in this business for eight years, earning about 6,000 KHR per day.

Rath is a first time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The other two have been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. Rath is now leading her group of three to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and feed for her pigs. She hopes to grow her business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for her shell crafting business.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fruit and vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

NWTF is relisting Luciana 's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her fish.

NWTF is relisting Leticia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of feed for her fish.

loans.name: Sideth's Group

texts.en:
Sideth is a 29-year-old father of two dependent children in a rural village of the Ratanak Mondul district, Cambodia. He and his wife are farmers who have been planting red maize as the main family business for three years. To better support his family, he also works at a cassava factory. The current business earns his family about 10,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Sideth’s group of two. They completely repaid the first loan with VisionFund. The first loan has helped his family afford sufficient food. Now he is leading his group to apply for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. Sideth will use his portion to buy fertilizers and pay for land plowing. He hopes this loan will enable him to improve his business and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his business.

loans.name: Melesete

texts.en:
Melesete is a 34-year-old married woman with five children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taros and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Melesete has requested a loan to re-supply new equipment to help her improve her plantation. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Melesete hopes to increase and earn a good income from her plantation so she can provide a good education for her children and also improve her home.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for the plantation such as bush knives, planting tools, rakes, fertilizers, chemicals, and more taro roots.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a 35-year-old married woman with two children in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elvie has a dried fish business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell in her food stall.

Elvie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a trisikad (a bicycle with a rider seat attached on the side) rentals business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad transport business.

Virginia has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from hog-raising.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad transport business.

loans.name: Bella

texts.es:
Bella tiene 43 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Su pareja es Javier, con quien tiene nueve hijos. Su casa es propia, allí viven junto a tres de sus hijos, y juntos luchan por llevar una vida digna y encaminada al éxito.

Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas de la región. Ha acondicionado un pequeño espacio en su vivienda, hace 3 meses, y ahí ofrece los frutos más frescos, sanos y jugosos de la ciudad. Todos los frutos que pone a la venta los consigue de su chacra o en algunas ocasiones los obtiene comprando al por mayor en el mercado de la ciudad. Anteriormente, ha trabajado por muchos años, vendiendo por sacos todos los frutos que obtenía de su chacra en el mercado de la ciudad, pero vio que era más rentable venderlos por unidad y es por eso que decidió cambiar su ritmo de trabajo y optó por este nuevo sistema. Recibe siempre la ayuda de su pareja, quien se encarga de manipular los pesados bultos y de acondicionar el lugar en el que venden. Ahora, ha visto la opción de vender plátano en racimos, ya que asegura que le brindará mayores ganancias. Su trabajo le ha permitido tener algunas satisfacciones en su vida familiar, ya que ha podido darse ciertos gustos materiales que siempre ha deseado. Sus ingresos económicos son muy buenos y en algún momento anhela establecer una frutería mejor implementada, donde pueda ofrecer una mejor calidad de atención y frutos de todo el país.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera poder cumplir con lo exigido y ser una buena socia; responsable y puntual. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le están dando para así poder aumentar su capital de trabajo.

El monto que está solicitando (800 soles) lo invertirá en la compra diaria de frutas, por sacos o cajas, y algunos racimos de plátano para ir aumentando poco a poco sus ganancias. Cada racimo de plátano puede llegar a costar hasta 15 soles, y el saco de naranjas u otras frutas cuesta hasta 50 soles. Diario, su inversión varía entre 100 soles, esto depende del tamaño, la cantidad y el  tipo de fruta que compra para vender.
texts.en:
Bella, 43, is an enterprising, very hardworking woman.  Her spouse is Javier and they have nine children.  Her house is hers and three of her children live there with them.  They all strive together to have a dignified life that’s aimed at success.

She sells regional fruit.  She’s set aside space at home for her business.  She’s been in operation three months there selling the freshest, healthiest and juiciest fruit in the city.  She gets all the fruit she puts on sale from her own fields or sometimes buys it at wholesale in the city market.  

She used to work for many years selling sacks of fruit from her fields in the city market but she realized that it was more profitable to sell them by the unit which is why she decided to change the rhythm of her work and opted for this new system.

She can always count on help from her spouse who takes care of doing the heavy lifting and to fix up the space where they do their selling.  Now, she has the option of selling bananas by the bunch sure that greater profits can be had.  

Her work has led to satisfactions in her family life because she’s been able to provide some creature comforts that she’s always wanted.  Her income is very good and she’d like at some point to open a well-stocked fruit store where she can offer a better quality service and fruit from throughout the country.

This is her first MFP loan.  She expects to be able to meet all requirements and to be a good member who is responsible and punctual.  She’s very grateful for the opportunity she’s being given to increase her working capital.

The amount she’s requesting (800 soles) will be used to buy fruit daily either in sacks or cases as well as some bunches of bananas to gradually increase her profits.  Each bunch of bananas can cost up to 15 soles and the sack of oranges or other fruit can cost up to 50 soles.  Every day her investment varies around 100 soles depending on size, quantity and type of fruit she buys to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca (fiber from the abaca palm leaf) weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

Victoria has been in this business for fifteen years. She earns more income from hog raising.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Safia

texts.pt:
Viúva e não tem filhos, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 2 irmãos que vivem com ela. 	
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de cobertores e cortinas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (mantas, lençóis, cortinas, colchas, fatos, e outros) para aumentar e diversificar a sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja construir dependências para aluguer e um murro de vedação na sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o acesso aos financiamentos, e a instabilidade do seu negócio.
texts.en:
She's a widow and doesn't have children. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports two siblings who live with her.
She runs her own business selling blankets and curtains. With the current loan she intends to purchase products (blankets, sheets, curtains, bedspreads, suits, etc.) in order to stock up and diversify her merchandise.
In the future she wishes to build rooms for renting and an enclosing wall for her house. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is access to loans and instability in her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (blankets, sheets, curtains, bedspreads, suits, etc.).

loans.name: Lesbia Yamileth

texts.es: La Sra. Lesbia es comerciante de mariscos desde hace quince años, ella empezó su pequeño negocio primeramente por cuenta propia, vendiendo de todo tipo de pescado en el casco urbano de san Rafael del sur, luego se le presento la oportunidad de financiarse de una micro financiera que visito la comunidad de masa chapa, sin embargo ella manifestó que por los altos intereses no continuo trabajando con préstamos, actualmente sigue vendiendo de forma ambulante, ya que cuenta con clientes de los cuales por muchos años ha tenido una estrecha relación de trabajo, sin embargo gracias a Dios y a su esfuerzo adquirió un frezzer de 500 lbs, donde mantiene una gran variedad de mariscos disponibles para su comercialización, el crédito otorgado por ceprodel lo utilizo para ampliar su mercado y mejorarlo.
texts.en:
Lesbia makes a living selling fish and seafood, and has worked in this trade for 15 years. She started her small business primarily for herself, selling all kinds of fish in the city center of San Rafael del Sur. She later had the opportunity to finance her business through a loan when a micro-finance officer visited her community of Masa Chapa. However, as a result of high interest rates, she did not continue with successive loans.

Presently, Lesbia travels around selling fish and other seafood items, and she has grown her customer base significantly over the years. Thanks to her hard work and with God's help, she has been able to acquire a freezer with a storage capacity of 500 lbs, which she uses to keep her merchandise cold and ready for sale and distribution. With the support from this loan, she plans to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase snapper, lobster, mackerel and other fish for resale.

loans.name: Manuela Margarita

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por la diversidad de sus productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Manuela tiene 55 años  de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo el mismo que ya es mayor de edad pero aun vive con ella.
  
Nuestra amiga es una mujer mayor que a pesar de su edad le gusta valerse por sí misma y obtener sus propios ingresos, ella en sociedad con su hijo tienen una fábrica de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), allí su hijo trabaja junto con dos ayudantes que se encargan de fabricar los ladrillos los mismos que luego entregan a comerciantes para luego llevarlos a distintos lugares donde los comercializan, nuestra amiga les ayuda realizando los cobros de lo que venden y  llevando la comida al lugar donde ellos laboran, ellos lleva más de 15 años en esta labor y les va muy bien, es así como ellos pueden salir adelante y poder ganarse el pan diario y el de las familias de  las dos personas que laboran con ellos.

Este crédito es para comprar leña, aserrín, palmito que son los materiales que emplean para elaborar estos productos. Lleva 8 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para llevar sus productos directamente a las construcciones.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for the diversity of its typical products like the famous straw hats that are well-known both inside and outside the country for example, the members of the “La Dolorosa Del Pechiche” communal bank meet every fifteen days. We met Manuela, 55, here.  She’s a single mother of a son who is already an adult but still lives with her.

She is an older woman who despite her age still enjoys supporting herself and earning her own income.  She and her son are partners in a brick factory (material used in home construction).  Her son works there with the help of two assistants who manufacture the bricks that are subsequently delivered to merchants who take them to be sold in various places.  Our friend helps by collecting payment for what’s sold and by taking food to the place where they work.  They’ve been in this business for more than 15 years and they do very well.  This is how they are able to get ahead and earn their daily bread and that of the families of the two people that work with them.

This loan is to buy wood, sawdust and hearts of palm which are the materials used to manufacture these products.  She’s been in the communal bank for 8 years and likes it because of the help they give with the loans.  Her dream is to have a vehicle to transport her products directly to building sites.

loans.use: to buy wood, sawdust and hearts of palm.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines.

Susana has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving.

Susana has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a raffia-making business in the Philippines.

Regina has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business.

Regina has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough for the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her raffia-making.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos dos quais apenas 1 frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a sua prima que vive com ela. 	
Trabalha como docente numa das Escolas do Distrito de Boane. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, cimento, carrinha de mão, cola, tinta e outros) para melhorar a sua residência. 
No futuro deseja concluir esta residência, mobilar e terminar o curso de licenciatura, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é adquirir uma viatura para o transporte pessoal, e o elevado custo de vida.
texts.en:
She's single and has two children, only one of whom attends school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports her cousin who lives with her.
She works as a teacher in one of the schools of the district of Boane. With the current loan she intends to purchase construction supplies (beams, cement, a wheelbarrow, adhesive, paint, etc.) in order to improve her home.
In the future she wishes to finish building her home, furnish it and finish her undergraduate studies. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is purchasing a vehicle for personal transportation, and also the high cost of living.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (beams, cement, a wheelbarrow, adhesive, paint, etc.).

loans.name: San Gregorio  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal San Gregorio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colorado del Cantón  Montecristi,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este Banco Comunal está integrado por 10 mujeres y 2 hombres, en este grupo conocimos a la señora Solanda Narcisa ella tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 2 hijos  de 12 y 6 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es artesano.
 
Nos cuenta nuestra amiga que este es un grupo de personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que al enterarse de los beneficios que les brinda la institución decidieron unirse y formar este grupo para así mejorar sus negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como cría de animales, comercio en general, entre otras actividades.

Nuestra amiga junto con el esposo tienen un negocio familiar, ellos tienen una pequeña fábrica en la cual elaboran botones hechos de tagua, allí ellos dia a dia trabajan dándole forma a sus productos los mismos que una vez por semana entregan a comerciantes mayoristas que llegan hasta el lugar para luego llevarlos a Manta, lugar donde los embarcan y envían  a otros países para que allá les den el acabado necesario para poder ser comercializados, con ellos trabaja una señora a quien  le pagan un sueldo semanal, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que es un trabajo bastante duro pero tiene sus recompensas y  les queda buenos ingresos porque la mayoría del trabajo lo realizan ellos mismos. Tienen más de 8 años con su fábrica y siempre les ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar tagua para elaborar los botones, este es el primer ciclo igual que todo el grupo y espera seguir por mucho tiempo más recibiendo la ayuda del banco.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos tengan lo mejor.
texts.en:
The “San Gregorio” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado Parish in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

This communal bank has 10 women and two men.  We met Solanda Narcisa here.  She’s 33-years-old, married and has two children who are 12 and 6 years of age and attend school.  Her husband’s an artisan.

She relates that this is a group of very humble, hardworking people who decided to join together and form this group when they found out about the benefits the institution provides in order to improve their businesses.  They are in a variety of activities like animal husbandry and general commerce among other activities.
 
Along with her husband she owns a family business.  They have a small factory where they manufacture buttons made of ivory palm.  They work there day to day giving shape to their products which they deliver once a week to wholesalers that come by to then take them to Manta where they are shipped and sent to other countries to be finished there and be sold.  A woman they pay a weekly salary works with them.  She tells us that it’s quite hard work but it has its rewards and produces good profits because they do most of the work themselves.  They’ve had the factory for more than 8 years and have always done very well.

This loan is to buy ivory palm to manufacture the buttons.  This is their and the entire group’s first cycle and they hope to continue getting help from the bank for a long time to come.  Her dream is that her children have the best.

loans.use: to buy ivory palm.

loans.name: Geanny

texts.es:
Geanny tiene 23 años, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante y es muy trabajadora. Su pareja desde hace 7 años con Milton, junto a él tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años. Toda su familia vive en la casa propia que le dejó su padre como herencia, desde ahí lucha constantemente junto a su cónyuge para llegar al éxito y brindarle a sus hijas un mejor futuro.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, huevos, azúcar, aceite y algunas verduras, que a diario se necesitan para la alimentación en el hogar. Tiene una pequeña bodega que pudo construir hace 4 años en su casa y ahí trabaja sola o en ocasiones lo deja al cuidado de su pareja. Renueva toda su mercadería de manera semanal, ya que la venta en su sector es muy fluida y eso le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten solventar algunos gastos educativos y alimenticios de sus hijos. 
Se siente muy tranquila, pero no se conforma con lo que ha logrado, es por eso que desea incrementar su capital para poder incluir nuevos productos envasados y aumentar el stock de todo lo que ofrece a la venta, comprando gaseosas, embutidos, helados y algunos artículos de pasamanería, con el objetivo de multiplicar sus ingresos para empezar a juntar el dinero que necesita para mejorar su vivienda, pensando en la seguridad y comodidad de sus pequeños hijos.

Este es el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera que los integrantes de su grupo la puedan ayudar a integrarse rápido para continuar trabajando junto a ellos de ahora en adelante, ya que considera que siempre es importante aumentar el capital de trabajo para hacer crecer su negocio.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 300) comprará algunos embutidos, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, huevos, pan, leche y otros artículos que necesita para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Geanny, age 23, is a woman with a great desire to get ahead, and she is very hard-working.   She and her life partner of seven years, Milton, have two children, ages five and three.  The whole family lives in their own house, which her father left her as an inheritance.   This is where she and her husband are always struggling to be successful and to give their daughters a better future.

Her work consists of selling basic needs products like rice, eggs, sugar, cooking oil, and some vegetables.   These are products that are needed every day to feed the household.  She has a small grocery store, which she was able to build in her house four years ago.  She works there alone, or she occasionally leaves it under her husband’s care.

She restocks her merchandise weekly.  Sales in her sector are very fluid, and this generates good income that allows her to pay some of her children’s expenses for education and food.   She feels very at ease, but she  will not stop with what she has achieved.  That is why she wishes to increase her capital in order to be able to include new packaged products.  She wants to increase her stock of everything that she sells.  She will buy soft drinks, sausages, ice cream, and some handicraft items.  Her objective for doing this is to increase her income in order to start getting together the money that is needed to improve her home.  She is thinking about her young children’s safety and comfort.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She hopes that the members of her group are able to help her assimilate rapidly in order to continue working together with them from now on.  She feels that it is always important to increase working capital in order to make her business grow.

She will use the requested 300 soles to buy some sausages, soft drinks, rice, sugar, eggs, bread, milk, and other items that she needs to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy some sausages, soft drinks, rice, sugar, eggs, bread, milk, and other items that she needs to stock her store.

loans.name: Gulzina

texts.ru:
Гульзине 35 лет. Гульзина в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 8,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Гульзины в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 1 корова с теленком, 5 овец, 1 лошадь с жеребенком, продажа молока приносит около 6,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульзина обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 4 голов овец.  Доходы от кредита Гульзина будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulzina is 35 years old. She has been doing animal husbandry and field crop cultivation for the past ten years as an additional source of income for her family, a business which she started with an amount of 8,000 som. Because of her hard work Gulzina now has one cow with a calf, five sheep and one horse with a foal as well as the sale of milk which brings around 6,000 som a month.

With a goal to grow her business further Gulzina has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy four heads of sheep. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase four heads of sheep.

loans.name: Farhodjon

texts.ru: Фарходчон житель города Душанбе. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Фарходчон покупает автомашины и сдает в аренду. Сейчас у него имеются две автомашины марки STAREX, которые отданы в аренду. Он берет кредит для приобретения еще одной автомашины этой же марки, чтобы начать свою деятельность.
texts.en: Farhodjon is a resident of Dushanbe. He is 28 years old and married. His wife is a homemaker. Farhodjon buys cars and rents them out. At this time he has two cars by make of Starex which have been rented out. He is taking out the loan to buy one more vehicle by the same make to start his business.

loans.use: to purchase a car by make of STAREX.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Cambodia, Im is 37 years old and married. She has four children: two daughters and two sons, who are still in school and dependent on her. To make a living and take care of her children, she is a grocery seller while her husband plants rubber seedlings for sale. She has been in the business for several years. The main challenge is unhealthy rubber seedlings.

Im has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and has completely repaid the loans. She successfully used the loans from VisionFund to better support her family’s living and business and also to send her children to school. With a good business, she is applying for a loan to buy more grocery items for her store, as well as to buy plastic bags for rubber seedling plantings. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her business and make more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags for rubber seedling planting.

loans.name: Lunai

texts.en:
Lunai is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. 
She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Lunai has requested a loan to help her develop and improve her plantation. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Lunai hopes to earn a good income to be able to help her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her plantation such as chemicals, fertilizers, bushknives, taro roots, wheelbarrows, and forks.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 30 years. She also earns income from e-loading and raising livestock.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her manicure business.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a 42-year-old married woman with five children, ages 22, 20, 18, 13 and six.
Emelita has been in the business of raising hogs for 20 years. She is asking for a loan worth 8,000 PHP which will be used to buy feed for the hogs and  repair the pigpen. 
In the future, Emelita would like to expand her hog-raising business by buying more piglets to raise. Emelita works hard to earn more because she wants to continue sending her children to school for a better education. Also, she wants to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for the hogs and repair the pigpen.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlene is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Arlene has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Arlene has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for five years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retail business in the Philippines.

Corazon is borrowing PHP 1,650 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency. Corazon is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support six children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a PHP 1,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season. Rebecca is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 3 filhos todos maiores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 2 netos que vivem com ela. 	
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de roupas usadas e produtos de primeira necessidade. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (fardos de roupa, farinha, óleo, peixe, arroz, e outros) para aumentar e diversificar a sua mercadoria.  

No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio adquirindo um congelador para conservar os produtos e conquistar mais clientes, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a saturação do mercado e o bem-estar da sua família.
texts.en:
She's a widow and has three children, all of them adults. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports two grandchildren who live with her.
She runs her own business selling used clothing and essential goods. With the current loan she intends to purchase products (bundles of clothing, flour, olive oil, fish, rice, etc.) in order to stock up and diversify her merchandise.
In the future she wishes to expand her business by purchasing a freezer to store the goods and get more customers. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is market saturation and her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase products for selling (bundles of clothing, flour, olive oil, fish, rice, etc.).

loans.name: Efren  Flor  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Efrén Flor se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen Elizabeth, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 17, 12, 10 y 3 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y los 2 siguientes en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Es una ama de casa muy luchadora y trabadora que para ganar algo por su cuenta y contribuir para los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, al igual que su esposo que también vende este tipo de mercadería pero de forma independiente, ya que él se desplaza a los campos y lugares alejados mientras que ella vende por el sector donde vive y otras partes de la ciudad, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja unos cuatro días por semana,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada semana. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y les va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar  ropa de todo tipo y genero. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para que su marido vaya a vender su mercadería.

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Efrén Flor Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a place known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional festivities of San Pedro and San Pablo and for the happiness of its people.

This is a group of people who decided to come together some time ago and form this communal bank that has served them a lot since with the loans they have been able to improve the small businesses that they have.  The make a living from diverse activities such as shops, services and food sales among other activities.
 
In this place we meet Carmen Elizabeth, 35 years old, married and from this relationship she has four children who are 17, 12, 10 and 3 years old.  The oldest child studies in college and the next two oldest are in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a struggling, hardworking housewife that, in order to earn something on her own and contribute to the household expenses, makes a living in business.  She sells clothes of all kinds, the same as her husband who also sells this type of merchandise but independently, since he travels to the country and distant places while she sells in the area where she lives and other parts of the city.  Her form of sales is door to door.  She works four days per week, leaving her products with her clients on credit and then collecting the debt every week.  For five years she has made a living with this business and it is going very well for them.

She is going to employ this loan to buy clothes of all types and materials.  She has been in the Communal Bank from the beginning and she likes the speed with which the loans go out.
 
Her dream is to buy a car so that her husband can go sell his merchandise.

The two small photos are of two partners that couldn’t be present when the photo was taken of the group.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothing.

loans.name: Ines Virginia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por la diversidad de sus productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Inés, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de  17, 15, 11 y 8 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.

Nuestra amiga trabaja en una fábrica en la ciudad de Manta, ella realiza el crédito  para ayudar a su esposo para que este pueda sacar adelante el negocio él tiene, es una pequeña fábrica de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), él junto con el papá de nuestra amiga se encargan del trabajo de elaborar y vender los ladrillos, nos cuenta que ellos entregan sus productos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su fabrica para luego llevarlos a distintos lugares donde venden estos productos, llevan más de 10 años dedicados a esta actividad la misma que les deja muy buenas satisfacciones.

Este crédito es para comprar leña, aserrín, agua y palmito que son los materiales que emplean para elaborar los ladrillos. Lleva 6 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la seriedad con que se trabaja en la institución.
 
Sus sueños seguir adelante y que sus hijos tengan una muy buena educación.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for the diversity of its typical products like the famous straw hats that are well-known both inside and outside the country for example, the members of the “La Dolorosa Del Pechiche” communal bank meet every fifteen days. We met Inés, 34, here. She’s married and has four children who are 17, 15, 11 and 8 years of age.  The two oldest attend secondary school and the two youngest attend elementary school.  Her husband’s an artisan.

She works in a factory in the city of Manta and is taking out the loan to help her husband so that he can move his business ahead.  He has a small brick-making factory (material used in home construction).  He works together with his father-in-law manufacturing and selling the bricks.  She tells us that they deliver their goods to merchants who come by the factory to then take them to various places where they sell them.  They’ve been in business more than ten years and it produces very good profits.

This loan is to buy wood, sawdust, water and hearts of palm which are the materials used to manufacture bricks.  She’s been in the communal bank six years and likes it because of the formality the institution works with.  Her dreams are to continue moving forward and that her children have a very good education.

loans.use: to buy brick-making supplies.

loans.name: Rose
