Por otra parte, también labora, hace 7 meses, vendiendo cosméticos, perfumes y accesorios de cuidado y belleza femenina, lo realiza entre sus amigas y personas conocidas, al crédito y ejecuta la cobranza en un tiempo prudencial, de esta manera vuelve a juntar el capital necesario para renovar su mercadería. Lo que le gusta es que gana lo necesario para solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar, le está yendo bien, aunque realmente desea incrementar sus ingresos porque espera agrandar su negocio y tener una mejor exhibición de todos los productos que ofrece.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, sabe que puede cumplir con las exigencias de la entidad y de su grupo, siendo responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Hasta el momento los integrantes de su grupo le dieron una agradable bienvenida y le brindan la confianza necesaria para continuar siendo una buena socia.

El monto solicitado (S/.1000) lo invertirá en la compra de cinco perfumes y cinco talcos cuyo precio varía entre S/.35 a S/.40 cada uno. También comprará un saco de arroz y un saco de azúcar, cuyo precio promedio es de S/.150 cada uno; entre otros abarrotes. El monto restante lo invertirá comprando bebederos y alimentos para pollos, su otro negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 26 years old. She is a humble and hard-working young woman. Her partner of 9 years is Francisco, with whom she has three children, ages 8, 3, and 2, who are her motivation for working and her driving force to excel. Now she lives in the house of her mother-in-law, along with her children and her partner. Her brother-in-law also lives there with his children.

Her work consists of selling groceries in the store that she established in her home. There she offers everything that housewives need to prepare daily food, along with other ornaments and utensils. But in the last few weeks, she has seen the need to supply her business with hardware items, since her customers many times ask her for ropes, light bulbs, pipes, or keys that they need in their homes. She has had her little store for two years and works there with the help of her mother-in-law. Furthermore, she has also been working for seven months selling cosmetics, perfumes, and women's personal care and beauty accessories. She does this among her friends and people she knows. She sells on credit and make her collections in a reasonable period of time; in this way she recoups the necessary capital to restock her merchandise. What she likes is that she is earning what is necessary to cover the basic expenses of her household. It is going well for her, although really she wants to increase her income because she hopes to enlarge her business and have a better display of all the products that she offers.

This is her second loan with the MFP institution. She knows that she can fulfill the requirements of the organization and of her group, being responsible and punctual with her payments. Thus far the members of her group have given her a congenial welcome and offered her the necessary confidence to continue being a good member.

She will invest the amount she has applied for (1000 PEN) in the purchase of five perfumes and five talcum powders, whose prices vary from 35 to 40 PEN each. She will also buy a sack of rice and a sack of sugar, whose average prices are 150 PEN each, along with other groceries. She will invest the remaining amount buying water troughs and food for chickens, her other business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store, as well as cosmetics to sell and food for chickens

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is 39 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Marivic works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine pesos loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store. Marivic has been in this business for 15 years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, and fruits and vegetables to her customers. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 12 years.

Teresita requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a rug making business in the Philippines.   She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy materials for her rug making business.

NWTF is relisting Maria Theresa 's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy materials for her rug business

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia works hard to support her family.  Porferia is married and has vegetables selling business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 7 years.

Porferia requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
This is Juliet, 37, a resident of Manila, Philippines.  Her husband is Ronnie, a seaman.  She is a mother to her children.  She together with her husband manage their own household while operating the business.

Juliet operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Juliet is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and to maintain her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Juliet hopes her business will expand and grow into a mini grocery through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own house someday and to give her children a good education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima, 26, lives with her two children. She has a store where she sells clothes. In addition to this, she also operates a food stall. She’s been working in her business for two years and it’s given her good results.  She's located in a very strategic spot and has acquired a good clientele that prefer her because she always meets their needs with quality products and accessible prices, besides excellent service.

Halima is an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead and is always alert to new opportunities that will prove to her that she’s able to attain success with hard work and dedication.

Demand has increased so Halima needs to invest in more a variety of food for her food business, as well as a variety of clothes for her clothes business, in order not to disappoint her customers.  This is why she’s asking Yehu for a loan to purchase bundles of clothes, wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.use: buy clothes, wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Victoriana works hard to support her family.  She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring.  Victoriana is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Victoriana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 3 years. Evelyn also earns more income from selling frozen food.  Evelyn is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.  

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy weaving materials

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is 44 years old and married.  She works hard to provide for her family.  Antonietta runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 28 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.  

Antonietta has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.   She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 40 years old and married with 2 children.  Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 7 years.  She has previously received funds through KIVA.  

Helen has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.   Helen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en:
Stanley is a 30-year-old a business man.  He is married to Joyce. who is a business lady. They are blessed with one child. 

Stanley has been running  a tailoring business for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000 which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his second loan from  KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Stanley will use the loan to purchase more textile materials.  

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to open a boutique.

loans.use: buy textiles and thread

loans.name: Jesudjro 2 Group

texts.fr: JESUDJRO 2 est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même village et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Jeté(qui a la main levée sur la photo), est âgée de 49 ans et est mariée à un certain Yaoitcha. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Jeté vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a environs quinze ans que Jeté vend des boules de pâtes (faites à base de l’amidon du maïs) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Jeté vend des boissons et des biscuits. Jeté s'approvisionne dans sa région. C'est la première fois que Jeté et les autres membres du groupe JESUDJRO 2 sollicite un financement de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer leurs activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle.
texts.en: Jesudjro-2 is a group of four individuals living in the same village and belonging to the same community savings group. The group’s representative, Jeté (raising the hand in the photo) is 49 years old. Her husband’s name is Yaoitcha. They have four children, some of whom are in school and all in their care. Jeté lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various family needs. For about 15 years, Jeté has been selling balls made on the base of corn starch [a traditional dish] out of her house. As a secondary activity, Jeté sells beverages and cookies. She stocks up in her region. This is the first time that Jeté and the other members of the Jesudjro-2 group are seeking a loan from ALIDé, with the goal of bolstering their business and better meeting customer demand.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn, beverages and cookies.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 39-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of six children. Their ages are between 17 years and four months. Her husband is a worker who is paid a low salary. She operates a kiosk, which she has been running for the last six years. She says that it has also been a profitable project, but from time to time, she needs some support to cover her project's costs.

Mwanasha is requesting a 25,000 KES loan from Yehu to help her cover the costs of adding items to her kiosk. This will increase her sales and improve her family's income.
 
Mwanasha owns a house that has no electricity or piped water.

loans.use: To add items to her kiosk

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 26 years old and a business man. He is a single man, but he helps his parents. He has been operating a motorcycle transportation business for the past ten years. He earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to pay for his basic needs. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. George will use the loan to buy a motorbike. With the anticipated profit from his business, he will educate his siblings. 

His hope is to buy a taxi car, which will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 21 years old, is a single guy who is applying for this loan to pay for his semester fees so he can continue studying physics at the university and get his bachelor degree.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Haxhireta

texts.en:
Haxhireta and her family live in Albania. She is forty-four years old and married. She has two children, and they are twenty-two and thirteen years old. Only the youngest child is attending public school. Haxhireta has been in the livestock business for more than fifteen years now and proudly claims that she has been the only one who has financially supported her family all of these years.

She makes a profit from her business, yet it is difficult to save for a rainy day, since she is the only one who financially supports her family.  However, she loves what she does and is committed to it. She wants to grow her business and save for her youngest child’s university expenses.
 
She is aware that without Kiva's lenders' support, her goal will be difficult to achieve. For the first time, she is applying for a Kiva loan to purchase two cows.  Haxhireta is very appreciative of Kiva for the help.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is blessed with four adorable children aged 10, 8, 6 and five years old. To earn a living, Ma. Teresa engaged herself in a food vending business. She sells snack food such as biscuits, bread, and candies to the people in her community. Sometimes, she visits the school in the area and peddles her goods to school children. Her husband is a fisherman.
Ma. Teresa works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially for the educational expense of their children. 
At this time, Ma. Teresa is applying for a loan worth 6,000PHP to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, candies, bread and others. With these, she will be able to augment the number of items thus giving her a wider range of customers. 
Ma. Teresa hopes to increase their revenue in order to improve their livelihood. She wants to invest more so that she will be able to send her children to school for better learning.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, candies, bread, and others

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 45-year-old conservative woman, so her daughter agreed that we use her picture instead.
Sabah has 5 sons and daughters; her eldest is Samah who is appearing in the photo. Samah is a student working hard to get her bachelor degree. 
Sabah wanted to support her daughter in her studies so she applied for this loan in order to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour, rice and beans.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 51-year-old businessman. He is married to Mary, who is a business lady. They are blessed with three children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the past three years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Paul will use the loan to service his motorbike. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy another motorbike.

loans.use: to service his motorbike.

loans.name: Aurélien

texts.fr: Aurélien est un jeune de 32 ans marié père de deux enfants âgé de 4 et 6 ans. il a ouvert et gère un café-restaurant dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 3ans. Il ne s’en sors pas mal grâce à  son savoir-faire, son expérience, il a agrandit et fidéliser sa clientèle au fil du temps. c'est grâce à ce commerce qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa petite famille. mais il ne rapporte pas beaucoup parce qu'il achète des produits en détail. avec  ce crédit Aurélien pourra s'acheter  les casiers de boisson, 1 carton d'huile d'arachide, les alvéoles d'oeufs et le nécessaire du petit déjeuné. Il réinvestira une partie du bénéfice dans on café-restaurant pour l'agrandir et économisera le reste pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aurélien is a young man, 32 years old, married, and the father of two children aged four and six. He opened and has been running a café-restaurant in a neighborhood of the capital for three years. He does fairly well; thanks to his know-how and experience, he has expanded his customer base and secured their loyalty over time. It is thanks to this business that he meets the needs of his little family, but he doesn't bring much home because he purchases his goods at retail prices.

With this loan, Aurélien will be able to purchase racks of drinks, a carton of groundnut oil, packages of eggs and breakfast essentials. He will reinvest part of the profits in his café-restaurant in order to expand it, and will save the rest for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase racks of drinks, one carton of oil, and packages of eggs.

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari is hardworking and persistent entrepreneur. He always knows what type of merchandise is in demand and always tries to offer it to his customers at a reasonable price. 

Omari is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to expand his merchandise selection. He plans to purchase more bundles of clothes for sale. He says that his business is doing well, and he hopes that this loan will enable him to increase sales so as to continue meeting his customers' demands. Thanks to Kiva and Yehu for the first loan given. He also thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Les Chanceliers De Pistere Group

texts.fr:
Annerose  est la coordonatrice de son groupe Les Chanceliers de Pistere. Elle habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Annerose  n'est pas mariée et elle a 2 enfants.

Elle a dirigé son commerce vente de la nourriture cuite pendant les dernières 6 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Elle etait une ecoliere .

 Annerose voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans un commerce dont il vend des produits divers tels que boissons gazeuses et nourriture. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce

Des autres membres de sont groupe  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbon, le produits divers et cosmetologie

Annerose dit que ses défi principal sont les manques d'achats et trop de personnes lui ont demande le credit.
texts.en:
Annerose is the coordinator of her "Chanceliers de Pistere" group. She lives in the northern region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is limited. Annerose is unmarried and has two children.

She has run a business selling cooked food for the past six years. Before starting this business, she was in school.

Annerose would like to use this loan to invest in a business selling various products such as carbonated drinks and food. She hopes this loan will help her secure a larger store.

Other members of her group need loans for businesses such as selling charcoal, various products, and cosmetics.

Annerose says her main challenge is dealing with a lack of purchases and too many people who ask her for credit.

loans.use: To buy various products.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a 50-year-old mixed crop farmer, she is married to Ferdinand who is a business man. They are blessed with six children, the first four are adults while the others are 15 and 12, respectively. She has been in the farming business for the past 12 years with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Winnie will use the loan to buy a pig and feed. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to own a pig farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy a pig and feed.

loans.name: Rakaye Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est  responsable du groupe RAKAYE. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des pagnes  et prêt à porter depuis 15ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10. Ses clients sont hommes et femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 10 pièces de pagnes  et 02 dizaines de prêt à porter.

Mme veut  avec ses bénéfices  gérer sa famille et réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne inscrire ses enfants à l’école et subvenir à leur besoins.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatimata is the leader of the "Rakaye" group. She is the married mother of five children. The oldest is 18 and the youngest is 2 years old. Three of the children attend school, and Ms. Fatimata has six people in her care.

Ms. Fatimata has sold pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing) and ready-to-wear outfits for 15 years. She gets her supplies at the market in sector 10. Her customers are men and women.

She wants to buy 10 sets of pagnes and two dozen ready-to-wear outfits.

With her profits, Ms. Fatimata would like to manage her family and reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to enroll her children in school and provide for them.

loans.use: To buy 10 sets of pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African clothing) and two dozen ready-to-wear outfits.

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en: Gharam, a 20-year-old single lady, is the only sister of four brothers. Gharam has applied for this loan to pay for her semester fees so she can get her bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Paix De Jesus 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Obei est le coordinateur  de son groupe Paix de Jesus. Il est  mariée et il a 2 enfants. Il habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Obei a dirigé son commerce epicerie dont il vend riz,  pois et d'autre produits, pendant les 7 dernières années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir  pour renforcer son commerce. Obei pense que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce.

Des autres membres de sont groupe  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbon, le produits divers et cosmetologie et des produits alimentaires. Obei  dit que ses défi principal sont les manques d'achats et trop de personnes lui ont demande le credit et le manque des activites economiques.
texts.en:
Obei is the leader of his group "Paix de Jesus". He is married and has two children. He lives in the northern region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited.

Obei has run his grocery business, where he sells rice, peas, and other goods, for the past seven years. He would like to use this loan to invest and strengthen his business. Obei believes this loan will help him secure more business.

Other members of the group need loans for businesses such as selling charcoal, various products, cosmetics, and food items. Obei says his main challenge is a lack of purchases, too many people asking him for credit, and a lack of economic activity.

loans.use: To invest and strengthen his business.

loans.name: Wendzoodo Nooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme LAMOUSSA est la responsable du groupe WENDZOODO NOOMA.  Elle se porte bien ainsi que sa famille. Pour son  commerce, elle dit bien se débrouiller. Elle est mariée et mère  de 03 enfants. Le plus âgée a 35ans et le moins âgée a 15ans. 02 de ses enfants vont à l’école  et  elle a 03 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend du beure de karité  depuis 08 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les provinces du Burkina. Ses clients sont  ceux qui fabriquent le savon.

Mme veut  s’acheter  130 plats de beure de karité.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices  pour renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne toujours  avoir des clients à  l’extérieur qui vont acheter son produit.
texts.en:
Ms. Lamoussa is the leader of the "Wendzoodo Nooma" group. She supports her herself and her family well. As for her business, she manages it well. She is married and has three children. The oldest is 35 years old and the youngest is 15. Two of her children attend school, and she has three people in her care.

Ms. Lamoussa has sold shea butter for eight years. She gets her supplies in the provinces of Burkina Faso. Her customers are soapmakers. 

Ms. Lamoussa would like to buy 130 slabs of shea butter.

She uses her profits to strengthen her business. Ms. Lamoussa's constant ambition is to have customers from abroad who buy her products.

loans.use: To buy 130 slabs of shea butter

loans.name: Coeur Angelique De Oaunaminthe 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Elardain est le coordinateur de son groupe coeur angeliques. Il est marié il a 3 enfants. Elardain habite dans la ville de ouanaminthe d’Haiti. Elardain a dirigé son business pendant les 7 dernières années.

Elardain voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des charbon. Elardain espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres de coeur angeliques ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du tennis, du riz, le produits divers, cosmetologie et du poisson.

Elardain dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant. Il dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmentation du bussines. et est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les charbon.
texts.en:
Elardain is the leader of the "Coeur Angeliques" group. He is married and has three children. Elardain lives in the city of Ouanaminthe, Haiti. He has run his business for the past seven years.

Elardain would like to use this loan to invest in purchasing coal. He hopes this loan will help him expand his business.

Other members of the "Coeur Angeliques" group need loans for businesses such as selling sneakers, rice, various items, cosmetics, and fish.

Elardain says his main challenge is a lack of constant customers. He says that his main goals are to increase his business and to buy a truck to transport coal.

loans.use: To buy coal

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 29-year-old married woman, mother of two children. She opened a convenience store in 2009 to improve her family's income. Hiba is a hard worker, she used to work in a chocolate factory, but her family's needs made her think of starting her own business to cover their large expenses as much as she can.

Her business is expanding based on her customers' needs, for this reason, Hiba is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her products and to buy a new refrigerator necessary for summer  beverages. This is Hiba's first experience with Al Majmoua as a borrower. She hopes that this loan will widen her business and will attract more customers.

She is willing to provide her children the best education ever and hopes to be capable of providing them with University degrees.

loans.use: to increase her products and to buy a new refrigerator necessary for summer  beverages.

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Faida, leader du groupe d’affaire «Zawadi », est entrepreneur courageux, âgée de 47 ans, mariée, mère de 9 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un petit commerçant. Elle est vendeuse des de denrées alimentaires (arachides, ndagara, etc.). Environs 12 ans, elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 20e  cycle de crédit dans le programme de microcrédit de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 2 sacs des arachides, 1 sac de ndagara, etc. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et accroitre son entreprise. Les bénéfices de ses activités lui servent de réaliser l’épargner, de payer la scolarité, l’habillement, la nourriture, etc. , pour sa famille. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
This client, Faida, is the leader of the business group "Zawadi".  A courageous entrepreneur, she is 47 years old, married and the mother of nine young children who all attend school.   Her husband works in retail business.

Faida sells food products such as groundnuts and ndagara (small local fish).  She has been involved in these small-scale income-generating activities for about 12 years.

Through the microfinance institution Hekima and its credit program, she has obtained her 20th loan cycle.  She will use this new loan to buy two bags of groundnuts, one bag of ndagara etc.

In addition, she would like to see her children grow up comfortably and to expand her business.  Profits from her business will serve to put money into saving, to pay for her children's education, food and clothing. 

Faida thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded from the traditional banking system.

It should be noted that one of the borrowers is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy two bags of groundnuts, one bag of ndagara (small local fish) etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two sacks of rice and one sack of beans.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Álvaro, tiene la edad  de 47 años, está casado,  vive con su  hija y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para asistir su cafetal como el abono, herbicidas, y foliares. El actualmente tiene un terreno con un año de sembrado y necesita asistirlo para obtener de él una muy buena cosecha y también cuenta con una parte ya en producción que necesita también asistencia para fortalecer su plantación y así obtener un buen rendimiento de cosecha este año de producción. El tiene planeado con estas mejoras darle a su plantación pequeña más fuerza de crecimiento y que no sea tan propensa a enfermedades y la llegue a perder y con el terreno en producción aumentar la cantidad de producción de café con respecto al año anterior. El quiere obtener a largo plazo mayores ingresos de sus terrenos de producción y así tener una mejor estabilidad económica para su futuro y el de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 47 years old, married, and lives with his daughter and his wife, and they are his top priority.

He will use his loan to buy supplies for his coffee plantation such as compost, herbicides and foliar fertilizer. The field has been planted for a year and he needs to attend to it in order to obtain a good harvest and also with a part of it in production it also needs assistance in order to strengthen the plantation and thus obtain a good crop yield this growing cycle. He has planned with this improvement to give his little plantation more growing strength and to protect it from being prone to loss from disease and with this harvest to increase the quantity of coffee produced over last year.

Over the long-run he wants to earn more from his fields and to have better financial stability for his future and that of his family. This is the first loan he has received from Fudecosur. He has not had other loans from state banks but Fudecosur has given him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to take care of his coffee plantation

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “La unión del Esfuerzo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de vendedor en terreno, desde hace 3 años, específicamente venta de artículos para el hogar como  masajeadores, cubre camas, guateros eléctricos, hervidores, entre otros. Comenta que por el momento realiza su trabajo desde su casa a pedido de su clientela, ya que tiene su bebe recién nacido y no puede salir a ofrecer sus productos, trabaja de lunes a viernes y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras de la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará guateros eléctricos, hervidores, masajeadores para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Maria es instalar un local establecido donde pueda exponer su mercadería para que su clientela quede satisfecha al momento de comprar, y con esto generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Sus sueños son adquirir un local para la venta de sus artículos para el hogar y contar con más recursos en el hogar, ya que los hijos van creciendo y al mismo tiempo crece la necesidad de darles un buen pasar. 
Maria está muy contenta  y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Maria is part of the community bank "La Unión del Esfuerzo" in the city of Talca.
She has been working selling goods for 3 years. Specifically, she sells home goods such as massagers, bed covers, heated pillows, kettles, and more. She says that, for the moment she runs her business from home to orders from her customers as she has a new-born baby and cannot go out to make sales. She works Monday to Friday at hours when she is available. 
She buys her stock from distributors in the city of Santiago at low cost, which makes it economically desirable. 
She will use the loan to buy heated pillows, kettles, and massagers to stock her store.
One of Maria's goals is to open a store where she can display her stock so that her customers feel satisfied when they are buying. In this way, she would generate more income and get a better quality of life.
Maria lives with her husband and her 2 children. Her dreams are to get a store where she can sell her home products and to have more resources at home as her children are growing and, at the same time, the need to give them a good life is growing.
Maria is very happy and grateful for the loan and services offered by Fondo Esperanza. She also says that she feels very comfortable at the group meetings as there is generosity and unity.
Talca belongs to the Maule region located in the central zone of the country. It constitutes the administrative, cultural, and religious center of the region, being the most important city of Chile's Valle Central. In Chile, there is a curious saying about Talca: "Talca, París, y Londres." Among the explanations for this, some say that it is derived from an original saying in English: "Talca is like London" on account of the mist that frequently covers the city in the winter season, like in the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy heated pillows, kettles, and massagers to stock her business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia forma parte del Banco Comunal “La unión del Esfuerzo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de banqueteria, específicamente empanadas y tortas y venta de ropa usada, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja desde su casa junto a una amiga de lunes a domingo en la parte de banqueteria y la venta de ropa es de todos los días y el fin de semana aumenta sus ventas.
Su mercadería para la banqueteria la compra en la ciudad de Talca en supermercados y distribuidoras a bajo costo y la mercadería en ropa se la regalan.
Con el crédito comprará moldes, harina, cremas, masas, aceitunas y pasas. 
Una de las metas de Eugenia es tener un negocio establecido en el centro de la cuidad donde vive actualmente, así agregar maquinarias como batidoras, horno industrial para la creación de sus empanadas y tortas par su clientela, con esto generará mayores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida y buen pasar a sus hijos 
Eugenia vive junto a su esposo y 3 hijos de 13, 8, y 1 un año de edad. Sus sueños son tener un local donde venda artículos de cumpleaños y a la vez venta de tortas.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Eugenia is part of the community bank "La Unión del Esfuerzo" in the city of Talca.
She works making banquet food, specifically empanadas and cakes and she sells used clothing. She has been doing this for 1 year. She says that she works from home along with a friend from Monday through to Sunday for the banqueting business and sells clothes every day and she increases her sales at the weekend.
She buys her banqueting supplies from the supermarkets in the city of Talca and from low-cost distributors and people give her the clothes to sell.
She will use the loan to buy molds, flour, cream, pastes, olives, and raisins.
One of her goals is to have an established business in the center of the city where she lives so she could add machines like whisks and an industrial oven for making her empanadas and cakes for her customers. This would enable her to have better income and a better quality of life for her children.
Eugenia lives with her husband and 3 children of 13, 8, and 1 year of age. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell birthday supplies and cakes. 
She is very happy with the opportunities that Fondo Esperanza have given her as they have enabled her to invest in her business. What's more, she fells very comfortable with the company of the other entrepreneurs in the community bank as they share various activities and interests which also serve as a nice distraction. With respect to the trainings at the meetings, she has learned to run her business in a better way.
Talca belongs to the Maule region located in the central zone of the country. It constitutes the administrative, cultural, and religious center of the region, being the most important city of Chile's Valle Central. In Chile, there is a curious saying about Talca: "Talca, París, y Londres." Among the explanations for this, some say that it is derived from an original saying in English: "Talca is like London" on account of the mist that frequently covers the city in the winter season, like in the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy molds, flour, cream, pastes, olives, and raisins.

loans.name: Luis Uriel

texts.es:
Don Luis, sigue trabajando con su taxi, pues es el medio de apoyar a su familia, su esposa labora como docente, y sus hijos cursan el año escolar.
En lo cotidiano hay día, buenos en donde aborda mucho pasajeros, otros días no, donde se ve afectado, ya que el costo del combustible ah incrementado y son días regulares.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo comprara llantas nuevas, cambio de anillo y válvulas, engrase y alineación de dirección, para seguir brindando mejor servicios a sus clientes, haciéndose más favorable gracias a los financiamientos en Afodenic ya que no contaba con todo el capital para estas mejora que le es necesaria para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Don Luis continues to work with his taxi as it is the means by which he supports his family. His wife works as a teacher and their children are in school.
In everyday life, there are days when he has many passengers and others when he does not, which affects his business as the cost of fuel is rising and those days are regular.
With this new loan, he will buy new tires, change the ring and valves, get lubrication, and align the wheels so that he can offer a better service to his customers, making him more favorable thanks to the loans from Afodenic as he wouldn't have the capital for these improvements that are needed for his business.

loans.use: to buy tires, lubricants, and wheel alignment.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Doña Daysy , trabaja cada día en su costura junto a su esposo quien es sastre también, haciendo nuevos estilo, otros por encargo, ofertando a sus clientes una costura rápida y bonita.
Es por medio del financiamiento que ah obtenidos mejores ventas, ya que ha comprado  tela variada para hacer vestidos, lo que se ha ayudado para los gastos y compromiso en su hogar. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara cuatro royos de tela lino que equivale a treinta yardas, y dos royos de sincatex, para producir más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Daisy works everyday sewing together with her husband who is a tailor as well, creating new styles, others by request, offering clients fast and beautiful sewing.

It is through funding that she has obtained the best sales, as she has bought assorted fabrics in order to make dresses, which has helped towards the household expenses. With this new loan she will buy four bolts of linen which is equivalent to thirty yards, and two rolls of the Sincatex brand fabric, in order to increase production in her business.

loans.use: to buy six bolts of fabric in order to continue expanding her seamstress shop

loans.name: Mixtalia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mixtalía, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, comprándose plátanos verdes, dicho, aceite, bolsas, leña, para seguir en la elaboración de tostadas, el préstamo ayudará con los recursos económicos y solventar la necesidad de materiales que por el momento atraviesa.

Manifiesta que el credito anterior le permitió tener lo necesario para realizar sus ventas, considera que también sus ingresos han sido mejores a través de las buenas ventas, cambiando sus condiciones en el negocio y en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mixtalía has decided to obtain another loan out of the necessity of investing in the business by purchasing green bananas, oil, bags, firewood and other items to continue making tostadas. The loan will help with financial resources and to cover the necessary costs for materials which she currently faces. 

She states that the previous loan allowed her to have what she needed to make her sales. She also believes her income has been better because of the improved sales, changing her business situation and that of her family life.

loans.use: to purchase green plantains, oil, bags, firewood and other items.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, tiene la edad  de 36 años, está casado,  vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar una maquina de cortar madera  que necesita para ir fortaleciendo sus pequeña empresa de construcción. El tiene varios años de trabajar como constructor y ahorita está necesitando esta máquina para hacer mas ágil su trabajo y economizar tiempo valioso que se puede avanzar en hacer otros trabajos dentro de la construcción. El tiene pensado que con esta compra va a dar más agilidad y mejores acabados a sus trabajos por lo cual espera tener más oferta de trabajos y así ir generando más ingresos para su estabilidad económica y brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida en el futuro que es su primordial deseo de padre.   Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: 36 year old Edwin is married and lives with his 2 children and wife who are his major priority. He will use the loan to buy a machine for cutting wood that he needs to strengthen his little construction business. He has been working in construction for some years and right now is needing this machine to make his work more precise and save valuable time so that he can get on to other construction jobs. He thinks that, with this purchase, he will have a more agile business and better finishes on his jobs in which case he hopes to have more job offers and so to generate more income for his economic stability and offer his children a better quality of life in the future, which is his primordial desire as a parent. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better features and an interest rate that is much lower.

loans.use: to buy equipment and tools to do better construction finishing.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Faustina; la socia tiene 36 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verduras como zanahorias, cebollas, apio entre otros, la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, a la vez la socia se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuyes para su negoció.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the communal bank “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO.” The bank is located in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

The borrower’s name is Faustina. She is 36 years old, married and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of buying and selling vegetables such as carrots, onions, and celery among others, selling in one of the Cusco city markets, while at the same time she raises small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens in order to sell them later to her customers who request them. She has been in this business a good time and things are going well thanks to the effort she puts in each day being able by doing this to provide for her family.

The borrower is asking for a loan in order to buy guinea pigs for her business. She is happy for the loan and she pledges to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE ANGOSTURA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Brigida; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras como zanahorias,cebollas,tomates y lechugas, la socia vende en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, y en las noches vende sándwich como pan con queso, pan con carne entre otros  sándwich, la socia por medio de estos pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los sándwich.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como toamtes, cebollas, zapallos y lechugas.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Brigida is a member of the Virgen Purificada de Angostura community bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.  

Brigida is 42 years old, married, and has four children.  She balances her daily activities with a business selling vegetables such as carrots, onions, tomatoes, and lettuce.  She sells in the market from 8:00am until 5:00pm.  At night, she sells sandwiches, including bread and cheese, bread and meat, and other types.  With these small businesses, she is getting her children ahead.  

Her dream is to have a store where she can sell sandwiches.  She is asking for this loan to purchase vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, pumpkins, and lettuce.  She is happy with this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, pumpkins, and lettuce.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jesusa; la socia tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de flores, ella tiene un invernadero donde cultiva diferentes flores,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, la socia vende sus flores a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas y abono.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the community bank “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO.” The bank is located in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The borrower is Jesusa. She is 42 years old, married and has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with buying and selling flowers. She has a greenhouse where she grows different flowers. The member has been in business for some time and things are going well thanks to the effort she puts in each day. She sells her flowers to customers who place orders. She is a happy and responsible person and eager to continue working for her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy seed and fertilizer.

The borrower is happy for the loan and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga forma parte del Banco Comunal “La unión del Esfuerzo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de prestación de servicio específicamente alojamiento y servicio de comida, desde hace 5 meses. Comenta que trabaja  15 días seguidos y descansa 2 días, según las personas que tenga en su casa de alojamiento, tiene una persona que le ayuda a atender a su clientela, cada habitación cuenta con equipamiento completo. En estos momentos presta servicio a los trabajadores de una constructora de la ciudad de Temuco.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados para abastecer la alimentación que entrega en su negocio, y distribuidoras donde compra los muebles y línea blanca a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará una cocina de 6 platos, refrigerador, y camas, para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Olga en su negocio, es llegar a convertir su casa de alojamiento en un hostal, que sea más conocido y se ubique en el centro de la cuidad que ella vive, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Olga vive junto a una hija, sobrinas, y nietos. Sus sueños a nivel laboral, es tener su hostal para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, y a nivel familiar que sus nietos y sobrinas termine de estudiar para que tengas un buen futuro.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Olga is part of the community bank "La Unión del Esfuerzo" in the city of Talca.
She works in the service industry, specifically offering lodging and food and she has been doing this for 5 months. She says that she works for 15 days then rests for 2 days according to the people that she has in her lodging house. She has 1 person who helps her see to her customers. Each room is completely equipped. In these times, she offers service to workers for construction company in the city of Temuco. She buys her food supplies in the supermarkets and gets her furniture and linens at low cost from a distributor, which is economically desirable. 
She will use the loan to buy a six-plate burner, fridge, and beds, to supply her business.
One of Olga's business goals is to convert her lodging house into a hostel so that it will be better known and locate it in the center of the city where she lives as this would bring her a better quality of life. 
Olga lives along with a daughter, nieces, and grandchildren. Her work dream is to have a hostel so she can offer her family a better quality of live and her family dream is that her grandkids and nieces finish school so that they can have a good future. 
She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered to her by Fondo Esperanza as it enables her to invest in her business. She also feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs in the group as they share various activities and interests and this serves as a nice distraction. With regard to the trainings at the meetings, she has learned to run her business better. 
Talca is in the Maule region in the central zone of the country. It constitutes the administrative, economic, and cultural center of the region, being the most important city of the Valle Central of Chile. There is a curious phrase about Talca in Chile: "Talca, Paris and London." Among the possible reasons for this is that it is derived from a something an Englishman said "Talca is like London" for the mist that often covers the city in the wintertime, like in the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy a six-plate burner, fridge, and beds to supply her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos; él es un joven muy amable, alegre y trabajador, que tiene un gran deseo de superación y muchas ganas de apoyar a su familia;   gracias al apoyo de sus padres, Samuel puedo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Industrial, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, desde hace un año Samuel puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de calzado, él realiza sus ventas de  manera ambulatoria en el mercado central de su ciudad, desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su negocio, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas y puede atender a un promedio de 18 clientes; Samuel se encuentra a gusto en su negocio y cree que marcha bien debido a que sus clientes lo buscan por sus buenos productos, precios y por su trato amable y respetuoso.
Samuel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como zapatos, zapatillas, botas y otros, tanto para hombres, mujeres y niños; de esta manera Samuel tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá aumentar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, los cuales desea ahorrar para poder utilizarlos en la construcción de su casa propia y así con ello espera poder superarse y ejercer su carrera profesional, así como también desea poder seguir apoyando y mejorando la calidad de vida de sus padres quienes siempre han estado a su lado.
texts.en:
Samuel is a 21-year-old man who lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings.  He is a very friendly, cheerful and hard-working young man who has a great desire to do well and support his family.  Thanks to the support of his parents, Samuel was able to study for a degree in industrial engineering.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer and sometimes he cooks a delicious 'arroz chaufa' (a fried rice dish) to share with his family.

One year ago, with a lot of determination and enthusiasm, Samuel set up his small footwear business.  He makes his sales as an itinerant vendor in the central market in his city.  He works from early in the morning, around 10 hours a day.  He is able to serve 18 customers on average.  Samuel is very happy in his business and believes that it is doing well as his customers seek him out for his good products and prices, as well as his friendly and respectful service.

Samuel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy merchandise (shoes, sneakers, boots, etc.) for men, women and children.  This will give him a better-stocked business and he will be able to increase his sales and income.  He would like to save up this money to build his own home so that he can improve himself and carry out his professional career.  He would also like to be able to continue supporting his parents and improving their quality of life as they have always been there for him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shoes, sneakers, boots, etc.

loans.name: Jacinto Vladimir

texts.es: Jacinto tiene 37 años viviendo en la hermosa ciudad de Quevedo, está casado y tiene tres hijos de etapa escolar. Jacinto se dedica a la cerrajería trabajo que aprendió de parte de su padre, este tipo de negocio es la especialidad de la familia. Con el tiempo fue ganando experiencia y reuniendo capital de tal manera que ahora tiene su propio taller, el trabajo lo realiza con la ayuda de un empleado y empieza desde las 7:30 de la mañana hasta las 5:30 de la tarde. en su negocio oferta tubos, varillas etc., también hace hornos, parrillas y puertas enrollables para los negocios. Con el crédito que está solicitando va a comprar materiales de metales y herramientas que necesita para moldear los artículos. Le gustaría a futuro tener su propia fábrica de puertas enrollables así apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jacinto has lived in the beautiful city of Quevedo for 37 years.  He is married, and has three school-aged children.  Jacinto works as a locksmith.  He learned from his father since this type of work is the specialty of his family.  With time, he gained experience and saved money so that now he has his own workshop.  He has one employee.  They start at 7:30am and work until 5:30pm.  His business offers tubes, rods, and also makes stoves, grills, and roller doors for businesses.  

He will use this loan to purchase metal materials and tools that he needs to shape things.  In the future, he would like to have his own factory making roller doors so that he could support his family.

loans.use: to purchase metal and tools.

loans.name: Elci Maeli

texts.es:
La joven Elci es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su negocio, vive con su esposo y su hija. En el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 4 años de tener este tipo de negocio de venta de productos plásticos.
Elci el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de Baldes, Pailas, Cepillos, Escobas, Canastas y cerdos. Y de esta manera incrementar más sus ventas. Con el préstamo espera incrementar sus ventas y así atender mejor a sus clientes.
Elci espera tener mejores ingresos para tener mejor forma de vida.
Los sueños de Elci es poder terminar de pagar su vivienda y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Elci is a very hard-working young person who is committed to her business.  She lives with her husband and daughter in Choluteca department, in the south of Honduras.  She has been in business selling plastic products for more than four years.

Elci will invest her loan in buying pails, dishes, brushes, brooms and baskets.  This will further increase her sales.  She hopes to use the loan to increase her sales so that she can better serve her customers.

Elci hopes to make more income so that she can improve her living standards.

Elci's dreams are to be able to finish paying for her house and to provide her daughter with a better quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras, June 2012.

loans.use: to buy pails, dishes, brushes, brooms and baskets for her business

loans.name: Agua De Peumo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Agua de Peumo” está conformado por 20 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, venta de chocolates, venta de pasteles, tejidos, almacenes, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos perteneciente a la ciudad de Chillán.
Luisa, integrante del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, usa una chaqueta de color negro y lleva cruzada una cartera de color cafe encima de la chaqueta, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de kiosko, desde hace 3 años, lo ubica dentro de un liceo donde las ventas son muy buenas, en la ciudad de Chillan. Comenta que a veces la ayuda su marido, ya que el tambien debe cumplir con su trabajo, su horario es de 8ºº hasta las 17ºº horas de lunes a viernes.
Su mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en supermercados y distribuidoras de confites a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará confites como papas fritas, galletas, dulces, chocman y arreglar el piso de su kiosko.
Sus metas son continuar con el negocio del kiosko, y poder ampliarlo y agregar venta de frutas para los escolares.
Luisa vive junto a su esposo, sus 2 hijos de 5, y 1 año de edad y su madrina. Sus sueños son ampliar su kiosko y generar otros ingresos como vendiendo joyas ya que los hijos van creciendo y al mismo tiempo crece la necesidad de darles un buen pasar, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos, existe respeto y confianza. Comenta además que las capacitaciones impartidas le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio,
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
The Agua de Peumo community bank is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who work selling rope, chocolates, cakes, knitted goods, have grocery stores, provide services, and other things.  They all live in the city of Chillán. 

Luisa is a member of the community bank.  In the picture, she is standing in the first row, in the second spot from right to left.  She has a black jacket and has a brown purse on top of her jacket.  Her hair is dark brown.  She has worked selling from a kiosk for three years.  It is located inside a school in Chillán where the sales are very good.  She says that sometimes her husband helps since he also has to do his work.  Her schedule is from 8:00am until 5:00pm from Monday to Friday.  She purchases her ingredients and merchandise at supermarkets and distributors at low cost, which is financially desirable.  She will use this loan to purchase items such as french fries, cookies, candy, Chocman candy, and to fix the floor of her kiosk.  Her goals are to continue with her kiosk business and to be able to expand it and begin selling fruit to the students.

Luisa lives with her husband, her two children (aged 1 and 5 years old), and her godmother.  Her dreams are to expand her kiosk and generate other income by selling jewelry since her children are growing up, which increases the need to give them a a better quality of life.  

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza to invest in her business.  She is also feels very comfortable with her community bank, since the people are united, respectful, and trustworthy.  She also says the trainings that are provided have led her to invest more in her business.

Chillán is a town in the south-central area of Chile.  Its name means "sun chair" in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuches.  Chillán is known as the "Cradle of the Nation" or "Land of the Artists", since many important people in the history of Chile have been born there, including the well known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to purchase items such as french fries, cookies, candy, Chocman candy, and to fix the floor of her kiosk.

loans.name: Bety

texts.es:
Bety tiene 61 años. Vive en la casa que compró hace 27 años, en la localidad de Justicia Paz y Vida.  Ahí cuidó de sus tres hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con uno de ellos; Juan Manuel.
Hace 12 años tenía una tienda de comestibles, por problemas personales tuvo que retirarse a otra ciudad, pensó mucho en volver a su casa y poder trabajar en su localidad. Es así que hace un año regresó para cuidar de su hijo que se encuentra enfermo y por quien continúa trabajando sin descanso. Retomó su tienda de comestibles, donde vende todo producto de primera necesidad, pero según cuenta, sus principales ventas las obtiene de los dulces, ya que su casa se encuentra ubicada al frente de un colegio y los alumnos siempre consumen las golosinas que ofrece. Por esa razón quiere aumentar su capital de trabajo para comprar más mercadería, ya que todos los días tiene que comprar más dulces, pues se terminan rápidamente.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Juan Bautista” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP. Asegura que gracias al dinero mejorará su negocio, agradece también el apoyo que recibe de parte de su asociación, pues las personas que lo integran son personas buenas, que incentivan al progreso.
Bety invertirá el dinero en la compra de cajas de galleta, bolsas de caramelos y aperitivos en bolsa para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Bety is 61 years old.  She lives in the house she purchased 27 years ago in the town of Justicia Paz y Vida.  There she cared for her three children, but now only one of them, Juan Manuel, lives with her.  

Twelve years ago, she had a grocery store, and because of personal problems, she had to move to another city, but she always thought of returning to her house and working in her town.  A year ago, she returned to care for her son who was sick and for whom she continues working without rest.  She took over her store again.  She sells all types of basic products, but her main sales are from sweets, since her house is in front of a school and the students eat the goodies she sells.  For this reason, she wants to increase her working capital by purchasing more merchandise since she has to buy more sweets every day since she runs out quickly.   

Bety is a member of the San Juan Bautista solidarity group, and this is her second loan with MFP.  She says that the money will help improve her business.  She is thankful for the support that she receives from the association, since the people involved are good people who encourage progress.  Bety will invest this money in the purchase of boxes of cookies, bags of candy, and bags of snacks to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of cookies, candy, and snacks to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten cellphones to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 60 años. Vive en compañía de sus inquilinos, quienes son como una familia. Su casa la compró hace 30 años y está ubicada en el asentamiento humano Justicia Paz y Vida.  

A pesar de su edad, continua trabajado muy arduo, “me siento muy ágil”, comenta. Su principal actividad consiste en la venta de postres (gelatina, flan, leche asada y otros dulces) en dos colegios de su zona. Es así que después de mucha caminata y esfuerzo termina el día de Victoria, quien después comienza a vender productos de belleza por catálogo, de casa en casa a los vecinos de su localidad, como también a algunos clientes que van hasta su casa. Comenta que para este mes tiene muchos pedidos, por lo que su capital de trabajo disminuyó considerablemente, ya que brinda sus productos a crédito, “algunos me pagan dentro de 10 días, otros en un mes, por eso tengo que pagar los pedidos con anticipación para poder entregar a mis clientes”, afirma.  Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y espera poder tener las fuerzas para seguir trabajando.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Juan Bautista” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP. Asegura que gracias al dinero mejorará su negocio, agradece también el apoyo que recibe de parte de su asociación, pues las personas que lo integran son personas buenas, que incentivan al progreso.
Victoria invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más productos de belleza para brindarles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Victoria is 60 years old. She lives in the company of her tenants, who are like family. She bought her house 30 years ago and it is located in the community of Justice, Peace and Life. 

Despite her age, she continues to work very hard, "I feel very agile," she told us. Her primary activity consists of the sale of desserts (jello, flan, custard and other sweets) at two schools in her neighborhood. This way, after a lot of walking and effort the day ends for Victoria, who afterwards begins to sell beauty products by catalogue, door to door in the homes of her neighbors in her community. Some of her customers also come to her home. She told us that she has many orders this month, so her working capital has decreased considerably, because she offers her products on credit.  "Some pay me within 10 days, others within a month, because of this I have to pay the orders in advance to be able to deliver to my customers", she said. She is a woman who works very hard and hopes to have the strength to continue working.

She is a member of the collective group "San Juan Bautista" and this is her second loan with MFP. She ensures that with this funding she will improve her business, she is also grateful for the support that she receives from her association, that has many good people in it, which incentives progress. Victoria will invest the requested money in the purchase of more beauty products to provide them to her clients.

loans.use: To buy the beauty products she has on order for her clients

loans.name: Zenobio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE ANGOSTURA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Zenobio; el tiene 48 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como controlador de carros que hacen servicio publico, el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño del socio es mejorar en su trabajo y terminar de construir su casa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como yeso y arena para que termine de construir su casa.
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Virgen Purificada de Angostura"; the bank is located int he district of Cusco, it belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Zenobia; he is 48 years old and he is a cohabitant  and has two children. He alternates his daily activities with work as controller of traffic that he does as a public servant. He works from 5:00am until 1:00 pm. Though this work he is able to progress forward with his children. His dream is to improve his work and to complete the construction of his house. He requests this loan to buy construction materials like plaster and sand so that he can complete the construction of his house. He is pleased because of the loan and he undertakes to complete all the payments from his share.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like plaster and sand so he can complete the construction of his house.

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es:
Myriam tiene 30 años. Vive en una casa que alquiló hace 3 años, en la localidad de Justicia Paz y Vida, ahí cuida de sus cuatro hijos.  
Su mayor deseo es tener su propio restaurante, donde pueda preparar sus ricos platos. Por el momento solo trabaja en un puesto que alquiló en el mercado de la localidad. A partir de las 4 de la tarde, comienza a levantar la carpa, poner las sillas y su mesa, ya que sus clientes llegarán muy pronto a saborear los ricos caldos y platos de casa que prepara. Trabaja hasta muy noche vendiendo la comida, “me gusta mi trabajo, existen días en las que me faltan sillas para atender a los comensales, por ello quiero tener mi restaurante grande y adecuado”, afirma. Se encuentra ahorrando para cumplir con su sueño, lo logrará, ya que en las mañanas también trabaja vendiendo verduras y los fines de semana lavando ropa ajena. Con las ganancias que obtiene de estas actividades, cubre los gastos económicos de su familia. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Juan Bautista” y este es su primer crédito con MFP. Asegura que gracias al dinero mejorará su negocio, agradece también el apoyo que recibe de parte de su asociación, pues las personas que lo integran son personas buenas, que incentivan al progreso.
Myriam invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de dos ollas y una nueva carpa para la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Myriam is 30 years old.  She lives in a house that she has been renting for three years, in the town of Justicia Paz y Vida.  It is there that she cares for her four children.  

Her main goal is to open her own restaurant where she can prepare her rich meals.  Right now she only works at a stall that she rents at the local market.  Starting at four in the afternoon, she begins to raise the tent and set out the table and chairs, since her customers will soon arrive to taste the rich meals that she will prepare.  

She works well into the night selling her food.  "I enjoy my job.  There are days when I don't have enough chairs to accomodate all of my guests, and for that reason I want to have a restaurant that is big and adequate." she says.  

She has been saving in order to fulfill her dream.  She will succeed, since in the mornings she also works selling vegetables and during the weekends she washes clothes for her neighbors.  With the earnings that she makes from these activities, she covers the expenses of her family.  She belongs to the group "San Juan Bautista" and this is her first loan with MFP.  

She assures us that thanks to the money whe will be able to grow her business.  She is also grateful for the support that she receives from her association, since the people who run it are good people who encourage progress.  Myriam will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of two pots and a new tent to sell food.

loans.use: to buy two pots and a new tent for her business.

loans.name: Ruth Delia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE ANGOSTURA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ruth Delia; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos como papa,moraya y chuño, la socia verduras como zanahorias,cebollas,tomates y lechugas, la socia vende en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, y en las noches vende sándwich como pan con queso, pan con carne entre otros  sándwich, la socia por medio de estos pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los sándwich. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como tomates, cebollas, zapallos y lechugas.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
