The member belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE ANGOSTURA;” the bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to Cusco department and province.

The member, Ruth Delia, is 31 and single. She alternates her daily activities: selling dry products like potatoes and starches from white and purple potatoes and selling vegetables like carrots, tomatoes, and lettuces in the market from 8:00 a.m until 5:00 p.m. At night, she sells a variety of sandwiches, including cheese and meat among others. She has been able to provide for her children through this small business. Her dream is to have a stand where she can sell sandwiches. She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables like tomatoes, onions, gourds, and lettuces.
                                                                                          
She is pleased with the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like tomatoes, onions, gourds, and lettuces.

loans.name: Rabee'

texts.en:
Rabee’ is a 25-year-old guy who works and studies at the same time. He works in a bakery when he is not studying at the university. Rabee’ is majoring in banking and finance.

Rabee’ is requesting a loan to pay for his semester and registration fees.

loans.use: to pay semester and registration fees

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 39-year-old woman who is married to a public sector employee. She cares for her six sons and daughters. Nadia sells blankets to help her husband support their family.

Nadia is requesting a loan to start selling clothes in addition to blankets.

loans.use: to start selling clothing

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
La Señora Maximina es una persona muy trabajadora actualmente vive con su esposo y su hijo los cuales vive en el caserío La Chorrera municipio Namasigue de Choluteca. Doña Maximina se dedica a su trabajo de fábrica de pan. Doña Maximina el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar, levadura y leña.
Doña Maximina espera que en los próximos años pueda terminar su casa ya que vive en la misma casa con sus padres. 
A Doña Maximina le gustaría seguir trabajando duro para darle a su hijo la mejor educación y así que sea una persona de bien también le gustaría poder ayudar a su familia a salir  adelante. 
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Maximina is a hardworking person who lives with her husband and son in a house in La Chorrera, Namasigue district, Choluteca department. Maximina ia a bread maker and needs this loan to buy wheat flour, margarine, sugar, yeast, and wood. 

Maximina hopes to complete her own house in the coming years since she now lives in her parents' home. Maximina would like to continue working hard to give her son a good education so that he can be a good person and to help her family prosper.
Choluteca, Honduras - June 2012

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, margarine, sugar, yeast, and wood for her business.

loans.name: Habonaya

texts.en:
Habonaya is 37 years old and is the widowed mother of three children. For the past two years, she has been working as a fish monger in Mombasa. Habonaya was recently introduced to KADET LTD and this will be her first business loan.

Habonaya is requesting a loan to purchase more tilapia, Nile perch, and sardines to sell to customers. She will use her anticipated profits to buy more fish and pay school fees her children. Habonaya hopes to realize more profits from her business and further expand.

loans.use: to purchase tilapia, Nile perch, and sardines

loans.name: Abelinda Ayme

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE ANGOSTURA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Abelinda; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de crianza de pollos, la socia cría pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y también para comprar alimentos para los pollos. 
  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Purificada de Angostura" located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Ms. Abelinda, 29, who is married and has one child. The member combines her daily activities with the business of raising and selling chickens. The member raises chickens, growing and fattening them, and then sells them at market between 8 a.m. and 6 p.m. By means of this business the member is raising her son. The member's dream is to have a shop where she could sell the chickens. The member is seeking the loan to purchase chickens and also chicken feed. 

The member is happy to have the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and also chicken feed.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 54 years old and married with five children. She is from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. For the past five years, she has run a sari-sari (convenience) store and she is also a dressmaker. Her husband is a fisherman. Narcisa sells items such as rice, canned goods, sodas, and snack foods to her neighbors. Her business provides daily earnings that she reinvests in her business and also uses to provide for her family. Narcisa joined CEVI hoping to gain access to the financial services offered by the organization. 

Narcisa is requesting a 250,000 PHP loan to buy more items to sell, such as rice, canned goods, and soda along with materials for sewing such as cloth and thread. She will use the remainder of the loan to buy fishing materials for her husband such as fishnets and ropes. 

In the future, Narcisa hopes to take her business into the next level. She wants to expand and purchase more stock to attract more customers thus giving her the opportunity of increasing her sales and revenue. Most importantly, Narcisa wants to put some of her earnings to savings for future use and investment.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell such as rice, canned goods, soda and other items

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en:
Mwasiti is 50 years old and lives in Mwambalazi with her husband and their six children. For the past five years, she has managed her own business selling consumer goods in her kiosk. Mwasiti sells a variety of goods ranging from flour to fast-selling goods such as sweats and cigarettes. Her business is at her home and has been kept stable with several loan investments that have been a great help. Mwasiti has done very well.

Mwasiti is requesting a 40,000 KES loan from Yehu to purchase bales of maize and wheat flour, sugar, and other items to expand her business a little bit at a time. Her goal is to continue working and expanding her business so that her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE ANGOSTURA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Evelin; ella tiene 19 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de tejas y ladrillos, ella también trabaja en una empresa que elabora cremas de habas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo y este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ladrillos y tejas al por mayor. 
  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE ANGOSTURA” communal bank. The bank is located in the Cuzco district which belongs to the Cuzco province and department. 

Her name is Evelin. She is 19 years old and single. She alternates her activities between her housework and selling roof tiles and bricks. She also works in a business that makes bean soup. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She wants to get ahead with her job and her business. She is asking for the loan to buy bricks and roof tiles wholesale. 

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bricks and roof tiles wholesale.

loans.name: Puma Group

texts.en:
Neema, who is in her mid-30s, is married with a child who goes to school. For the past year, she has been running two businesses: a grocery store and a charcoal business. Neema works from 7 am to midnight daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

Neema is requesting her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her stock of beer.  She used her previous loans to purchase beer and soda, to buy a sack of potatoes to make chips, and also to start selling charcoal. Neema has successfully repaid her previous loans. 

Neema will share this loan with her loan group called Puma. This group has 18 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying their loan.

loans.use: to purchase beer to sell

loans.name: Gladis Eunice

texts.es:
La joven Gladis es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada 100% a su negocio, vive con sus 4 hijos. En el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 6 años de tener este tipo de negocio.
Gladis el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carnes, pollo, arroz, frijoles, manteca, café, pan y otros productos de esta manera incrementar más sus ventas. Con el préstamo espera aumentar sus ventas y así satisfacer y mejorar las necesidades de sus clientes.
Gladis sus sueños es poder mejorar su negocio, en hacerlo más grande y apoyar a sus 4 hijos y darles una buena educación.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
The young woman Gladis is a very hardworking woman who devotes herself 100% to her business. She lives with her four children in the department of Choluteca in southern Honduras. She has had this type of business for over six years. 

Gladis will invest the loan in the purchase of meats, chicken, rice, beans, lard, coffee, bread and other products and in this way will increase her sales. She hopes to grow her sales with the loan and thus satisfy and improve the needs of her customers. 

Her dreams are to be able to improve her business, making it bigger, and to support her four children and give them a good education.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, rice, beans, lard, coffee, bread and other products for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is 40 years old and is from Loon, Bohol. She is a food vendor who works hard to sell ices, popsicles, and steamed rice cakes. She also sells and distributes coconut wine. She uses her profit to meet the needs of her two dependent children. 

Ma. Liza is requesting a loan to buy more coconut wine from coconut farmers and to purchase school supplies for her children. If possible, she will also buy healthy food for her family. Ma. Liza is willing to explore other business opportunities to increase her profits and give her children a better education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine, school supplies, and food for her family

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 61 años. Desde hace 5 años vive en la casa que compró en la localidad de Huancayo. Ahí radica con uno de sus tres hijos; Miguel.  
Así también, hace 5 años vendía comida en tres puestos de comida que tenía en el mercado de la zona, le resultaba muy tedioso tener que trabajar desde la mañana, en el frío y sobre todo cargaba mucho peso. Esas razones causaron que ella se enfermara de gravedad. Por ese motivo que cambió de trabajo, lo que hoy en día es su principal ingreso económico, la venta de sábanas, zapatos, ollas y demás utensilios de cocina. Le va muy bien, siempre que puede lleva a sus clientes los catálogos para que le realicen pedidos. “En estos años, logré obtener muchos ingresos, ya que el precio de mis productos es barato a comparación con otras marcas que se encuentran en el mercado”, afirma. Su principal ventaja es que ofrece los productos de puerta en puerta, por lo que llega con mayor facilidad a las personas.  

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Las líderes del centro” y este es su primer crédito con MFP. Agradece el apoyo que recibe de parte de su asociación, pues ahora podrá mejorar su negocio. Y promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que quiere continuar trabajando con su asociación.
Teresa invertirá este dinero en la compra de mercadería: tres juegos de ollas a presión y si el dinero le alcanza comprará algunos pares de zapatos.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 61, has lived for five years in the house she bought in Huancay.   This is where she lives with one of her three children, Miguel.  This is also where, five years ago, she sold food at three food stands that she had at the local market.  It turned out to be very tedious to have to work starting in the morning in the cold, and it was especially tedious that what she had to carry was very heavy.   These are the reasons that she became gravely ill.  For that reason she changed her work.

What she now does as her main financial income is sell sheets, shoes, pots, and other kitchen utensils.  It is going very well for her.  Whenever possible she takes catalogs to her customers so that they can place orders.  “Throughout these years I managed to get a lot of income.  That is because the price of my products is cheap in comparison to other brands found in the market,” she says.  Her main advantage is that she sells the products door to door, which is easier for her to reach the customers.

She belongs to the Las Líderes del Centro communal bank.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support she receives from her association.  Now she will be able to improve her business.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments because she wants to continue working with her association.

Teresa will use the loan to buy three sets of pressure cookers.   If she has enough money left she will buy some shoes.

loans.use: to buy three sets of pressure cookers and some shoes.

loans.name: Renacimiento Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Renacimiento” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa usada, feriantes, costureras, venta de abarrotes, almacén, bazar, venta de completos, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Ana, presidenta del grupo del  Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta de color café, usa aros grandes de color plata, su cabello lo usa corto y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de bazar, librería, paquetería, su negocio es bien surtido, donde su clientela encuentra de todo, se dedica a este rubro desde hace 2 años. Comenta que su bazar lo ubica en una parte de su casa donde ofrece servicio de fotocopiado, insumos para la casa, artículos escolares, dulces, artículos en general para su clientela.
Su mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la ciudad de Concepción, y otras veces en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará insumos de fotocopiadoras, libros, hilos, agujas, tinta, platos ollas entre otros.
Las metas en su negocio son crecer y poder ampliar su local, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Ana vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja y la apoya en su negocio, su madre, y 2 hijos. Sus sueños son ampliar su local y a la vez instalar una peluquería ya que ella  antes se dedicaba a este rubro, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Ana está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Renacimiento”. It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different areas. Among these are:  selling used clothes, selling as a market vendor, seamstresses, selling groceries, runnning a store, a variety store, providing services and more. All of them are from the city of Chillan.

Ana, the president of the communal bank group, is seated in the photo third from the right in a brown jacket and large silver hoops, and short brown hair.

She has a variety store. She sells books, packing materials- her store is well stocked and her customers can find anything. She has done this for 2 years. She remarks that her store is located in a part of the house where she also offers a photocopying service, household supplies, school supplies, candies, and general items for her customers.

The merchandise and materials that she needs she buys in the city of  Concepción or sometimes in the city of Santiago. With the loan, she will buy photocopying materials, books, thread, needles, ink, plates and pots, among other things. 

Her goals for her business are growing and expanding her locale to offer her family a better quality of life. Ana lives with her husband , who works and supports her in her business, and her mother and 2 children. Her dreams are to expand her locale and at the same time open a hair salon since she previously worked in that area. In this way, she will generate more income and have a better quality of life.

Ana is very happy and grateful for the loan and services offered by the Fondo Esperanza. She also remarks that she feels very comfortable in the meetings and with the Communal Bank, since there is generosity and unity.

Chillán is a community in south central Chile. Its name means “chair of the sunl” in Mapudungun, the language of our Mapuche indigenous people. Chillán is known as the “Cradle of the Nation” or “Land of Artists”, because the city has produced noted Chilean historical figures, for example the well known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy photocopier materials, books, threads, needles, ink, plates and pots, among other things.

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta is a 58-year-old married woman. With the help of her two grown children, she continues to look after the sari-sari (variety) store that provides her income.

Mansueta is requesting a loan to buy products to sell such as rice, corn, soft drinks, and snack food. She will buy products that her customers use on a daily basis. Once her store if filled with basic items, it will attract more customers and increase her income. Mansueta will use the profits from her loan to save for the future and also provide for her family's daily food consumption.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, soft drinks, and snack food

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Pheng is 43 years old and the mother of two adult children. One of her children is employed away from her home province and the other is still attending school. Pheng is married to a kind, supportive husband who takes on a lot of family responsibilities. In addition to the main income earned by her husband, Pheng dedicates herself to managing a farming business to generate extra profit for her family. She aims to improve her living conditions and provide educational opportunities for her youngest child.

Pheng is requesting a 2,500,000 KHR loan to make home repairs. She plans to purchase another house to reuse its timbers, wooden floorboards, wallboards, and other supplies to renovate her house and provide a suitable and comfortable living situation. Pheng thanks her lenders in advance for their great help.

loans.use: to purchase a house to use its timbers, wooden floorboards, wallboards, and other supplies to repair her home

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 46-year-old married man who is the father of three children. Since 2010, he has worked selling pajamas, underwear, accessories, and bags. He used to work wholesale, but two years ago decided to open his own retail shop. His business needs a lot of cash to keep on developing it. Fouad works hard to provide his customers with the best quality and the best prices.

Fouad is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to purchase items for a summer collection and increase his business capital. This will be Fouad's second loan cycle with Al Majmoua. He hopes that his loan will help to continue to improve his business so that he can expand and attract more customers. In the future, he hopes to open another branch.

loans.use: to purchase a summer collection

loans.name: Serakazi Group

texts.en:
Hawa, who is in her late 30's, is married with two children who are still going to school. She has been a tailor for 10 years now. She works from 7:30 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. This will be her 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more materials and made better/different nice dress styles. She really had good business and managed to take her children to good schools and paid their school fees on time as well as household expenses. Hawa has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more material for making more dresses and suits and to pay school fees. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Hawa will share this loan with her loan group "Serakazi" with 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more material for making more dresses and suits and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years.

Marife requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married with 9 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosa is 62 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

Rosa has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. Rosa requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, school supplies and other miscellaneous items.

In the future, Rosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, school supplies and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Fima

texts.en:
Fima is 56 years old and married with two children. Fima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Fima has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Fima aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, school supplies and groceries to sell.

Julie has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from hog raising.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, school supplies and groceries.

loans.name: Soumboundou Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  est créé le 12 Décembre 2011 au jour de son inauguration. Composé de 28  femmes très actives dans les activités génératrices de revenu, elles vivent toutes dans le même village. Elles pratiquent dans leur majorité le petit commerce, particulièrement la vente de produits locaux transformés. 

Madame Fatou (assise à l’extrême droite dans la première rangée), est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, est mariée et mère de quatre  garçons et deux filles. Elle est vendeuse de patte d’arachide qu’elle achète par seau de 20 kilogrammes à 9 000 FCFA pour la revente en détail dans sa localité en sachet de 100 FCFA avec comme bénéfice moyen par seau de l’ordre de 6 500 FCFA.

Avec ce financement, elle compte dans un premier temps acheter 03 seaux de patte d’arachide et au fur et à mesure faire fonctionner son activité.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire de ses jeunes enfants.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois was set up and inaugurated on 12th December 2011. The group is made up of 28 women who all have income-generating activities and live in the same village. The majority of them have small trading businesses, in particular the sale of locally manufactured products.

Fatou, who is sitting on the far right of the photo in the first row, is the star borrower. She is 53 years old, married and mother to four boys and two girls. She sells groundnut paste that she buys by the bucket (20kg) for 9,000FCFA and then sells on a retail basis in her town in sachets at 100FCFA each, making an average profit per bucket of 6,500FCFA.

With this loan, she is planning firstly to buy three buckets of groundnut paste and gradually get her business off the ground.

The profits she makes enable her to help her husband out with the young children's schooling expenses.

loans.use: to buy three buckets of groundnut paste and gradually get her business going.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 28 years old. She is married to Joel, who provides additional income to the family. She has one child, who is four years old.

For four years, Linet has run a barber shop and salon. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is requesting a loan to purchase dryers for the salon and a shaver for the barber shop. The anticipated profits will be used to pay her son's school fees. 

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. Her hopes and dreams are to own a successful business and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy dryers and shavers.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. Florencia has been in this business for 15 years.

Florencia requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

In the future, Florencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 36 years old and married with four children.

Paulina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like school supplies, rice grains, feeds, snack foods and other miscellaneous items.

Paulina has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Paulina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like school supplies, rice grains, feeds, snack foods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, noodles and grocery products. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items  like snack foods, noodles and grocery products.

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en:
Consejo is 35 years old and has five children. Consejo is married and has four children who are in school.

Consejo is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Consejo requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Consejo has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Consejo would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 56 years old, married and has three children. She is in the agricultural business, doing hog raising in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fe has been in hog raising for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie is 21 years old and married with 1 kid.

Jennie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like snack foods, rice grains and other miscellaneous items.

Jennie has been in this business for 4 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Jennie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like snack foods, rice grains and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Berthe

texts.en: Berthe is 36 years old. She is a widow and has three children, ages between 7 and 10 years. They are all enrolled in schools. Berthe sells fabrics and has been in the business for the past 17 years. With the loan, she wants to buy different kinds of fabrics for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for sale

loans.name: Adulia

texts.en:
Adulia is married with 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Adulia is 36 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Adulia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Adulia requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment for her fishing business.

In the future, Adulia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is  a married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She is 41 years old with eight children. Her eldest is 28 and the youngest is 13. Her husband works as a welder and Sheila hopes that with her small business, she can be of help to her spouse in supporting their family. She is asking for a loan to buy 'buri' and rattan palms. 

Sheila works hard to support her family. Once the raw materials are available, she can focus on her production for better income. Sheila  hopes for her business to improve so she can better support her family. Her income will keep her children in school and provide for family daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy 'buri' and rattan palms as craft materials

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 32 years old and  has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Gina has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
This is Criselda, 40, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Reynaldo, a businessman. Together they manage their household and care for their children while operating the business. Criselda is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.  

Criselda operates a retail clothing business, selling men's and women’s clothes and related products. Her customers are attracted to her low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers include her neighbors and residents of the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy ready-to-wear clothing and merchandise to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her product offerings. 

Criselda hopes to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sylivie

texts.en: Sylivie is 32 years old. She has four children between the ages of nine months and 10 years. She sells different items in a boutique she has been running for two years. With the loan, she wants to buy more items to sell such as soaps, cooking oil, and juices. She plans to use the profits to buy a plot of land for building her house.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, cooking oil, and juices to sell.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en: Teo is a 46-year-old married woman. She has a daughter and one other dependent, both of whom are in secondary school. Teo is an agriculturalist; she grows crops and keeps animals. She has been selling her surplus to raise school fees for her children. She supplements her farming income by selling ghee (clarified butter) and milk from her cows. She wants to use this loan to buy a calf that she will graze to grow into a big cow. The cow will provide security in case of emergencies. Teo is very hard-working and honest.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Eliflor

texts.en:
Eliflor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Eliflor earns more income from food vending. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials for her manicure and pedicure business.

Eliflor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 61 years old and married with 7 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Felipa has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store. Felipa is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a 53-year-old married woman with seven children; she is from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Perla's husband works as a fisherman and also farms.

Perla works in the family's farm plot. They have been growing corn, rice, bananas, and other crops for ten years now. Perla is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for labor, fertilizer, and other operating costs for the rice field. She also plans to buy additional fishing nets for her husband's fishing venture. 

In the future, Perla hopes to increase the yield of their farm by implementing modern methods that are also environmentally friendly. She wants to reinvest in a retail business in the future to provide an additional revenue, and she also plans to save.

loans.use: to pay for labor, fertilizer, and other operating costs of her rice field and to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Kioko

texts.en:
Kioko is 49 years old. He is married and has three children aged 25, 21, and 15 years.

Kioko has been raising cattle for three years, and he earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. He will use the requested loan to purchase a calf and buy animal feeds. He will use the anticipated profits to buy poultry. This is his second loan from KADET LTD, and he has successfully repaid the previous loan. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and a calf.

loans.name: Nafal

texts.en: Nafal is a 36-year-old housewife caring for three sons. She is starting a small home-based business, selling clothes to help improve the family's living conditions. She has applied for this loan in order to add more clothes for different ages to her inventory. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more profit from her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.en:
Habibullo has a good character. If you meet him, you will like him at first because he is jolly, cheerful and smart. He is a master of telling funny stories. This side of his character helps him to attract many customers. 

For more than three years he has had his own business. He is a driver and conveys local people from one place to another. Habibullo has his own minibus. He has a big and friendly family. His wife tries to help him in all his business needs. They have four children and must send them to good schools and universities. Habibullo wants to build a new house for his children but his income isn’t enough. Please, help him to build a new house because his family needs it.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Jean Caryl

texts.en:
Jean Caryl is 24 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jean Caryl requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jean Caryl has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jean Caryl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dorothe

texts.en: Dorothe is married with eight children, aged between four and 23. She sells fish and has been in the business for 10 years. She wants the loan to add more volume of fish to sell. With the profits from the business, she plans on paying tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Naome

texts.en: Naome is 27 years old. She has two children and all go to school. She sells soft drinks and has been in the business for the past seven years. She wants a loan to buy more sodas to sell. With the profits, she plans to pay the children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sodas to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 36 years old. She has seven children, and all of them go to school. She sells utensils and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she wants to buy saucepans and cups to sell. The anticipated profits will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy saucepans and cups to sell.

loans.name: Benedeta

texts.en:
Benedeta is a married 37-year-old businesslady who sells secondhand clothes in Miritini, Mombasa. She has been running her clothing stall for the last two years, and she is doing great. 

This will be Benedeta's second business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more secondhand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to succeed and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour, is a 23-year-old married lady with a baby boy. Her husband is a public-sector employee. 

Nour is working on improving their living conditions to provide the best environment possible for her child. To do this, she started a home-based business, selling blankets to neighbors, friends, and family members. Through word of mouth, she is expanding to cover more areas and maybe will open her own shop. Nour has applied for this youth loan to add more bedcovers and blankets to her inventory.

loans.use: to add more bedspreads and blankets to her inventory

loans.name: Alexie

texts.en: Alexie is 33 years old. She sells charcoal and has been selling charcoal for the past 15 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house for her to live in.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fortunata; la socia tiene 47 años de edad, casada y tiene 6 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verduras , la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, a la vez la socia se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes  para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuyes para su negoció.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the Ima Sumac Suncco communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco province in the Cusco department.

Fortunata, age 47, is married and has six children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of buying and selling vegetables.  She sells at one of the markets in the city of Cusco.  She also raises small animals like guinea pigs, and she later sells them to her customers who ask for them.  She has been in this business a good amount of time.  It is going very well for her thanks to her daily determination.  This is the way that she gets her family ahead.

Fortunata is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Camila Lyli

texts.es:
Doña Camila sigue ofertando cosméticos y ropa variada de ambos sexo  negocio que aumentado en ventas, gracias a los préstamos obtenidos en Afodenic, tras dieciséis ciclos en donde ha mejorado su vivienda e invertido en su negocio. El cual le ha dado buenas ganancias.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en la compra de perfume, cosméticos, ropa variada todos estos productos para dama y caballeros, vendiendo al contado y al crédito productos Avon, muchos por encargos en variedad de productos. Contenta por poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Y poder cubrir sus necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Camile continues offering cosmetics and clothing for both sexes, a business that has increased in sales thanks to the loans obtained through Afodenic. After 16 loan cycles she has improved her home and invested in her business, which has brought her good earnings. 

Now, with this new loan she will invest in the purchase of perfume, cosmetics and assorted clothing, all these products being for women and men. She sells Avon products on the spot and for credit, many by orders of a variety of products. She is content with being able to fulfill her customers' demands and cover her personal needs.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of perfume, cosmetics and clothes, for both sexes.

loans.name: Uldan

texts.en:
Uldan is a woman who likes to work very hard. She tries to finish all her deals perfectly. Uldan is a business lady with lots of experience because she has been selling agriculture products for more than 18 years. 

She sells fruits and vegetables. In the local market she has own spot and a lot of customers. She has high quality goods so she attracts many customers. 

Uldan is widow and has three children. She wants to improve their living situation but her income isn’t high enough. She is asking for a loan to buy more goods to improve her business. Uldan wants your help and support.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kisanga Group

texts.en:
Johanes, who is in his late 20s, is single.  He has had a transport business, a Bajaji (a motorbike), for nine months now. He works from 4:00 am to 11:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan buy spares for the Bajaji and has paid back his loan successfully.  He now wants a loan to start selling fruits and vegetables.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Johanes will share this loan with his loan group "Kisanga"- 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 36 years old. She is married with two children, aged three months and three years. She wants the loan to buy more fabrics to sell. She has been in this business for the past eight years. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children from Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. She is currently engaged in a fishing business because her husband is a fisherman. She sells what her husband catches to the people in her community. They also do seaweed farming.  Seaweed farming is the practice of cultivating and harvesting seaweed. In its simplest form, it consists of the management of naturally found batches. In its most advanced form, it consists of fully controlling the life cycle of the algae.

Restituta works very hard to support her family, especially for their three children ages 8,6 and 3.  Restituta is now requesting a loan worth 5000 PHP to buy a new fishing net and some of it will be used for the maintenance and repair of their fishing boat.  In the next few years, Restituta hopes to expand their business so that they will have enough for their sustenance and for the education of their children. She adds that education is a very important tool in order to achieve success and professional growth. That why she is really adamant in sending her children for learning.

loans.use: buy a fishing net

loans.name: Annonciathe

texts.en: Annonciathe is 38 years old. She is married and has three children who all go to school. The loan she requested will be used to buy more ladies dresses  commonly known as Bitenge in Kinyarwanda. The profits from the business will be used for making more savings.

loans.use: buy ladies clothing to resell

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 23-year-old married father of three children. He opened a coffee shop in 2005 to make his living. Hassan has nine years of experience in this field and he puts in much effort to develop it as much as he can.

Hassan serves coffee, ice cream, Nescafe and smoothies, in addition to juices.  He is a hard worker, well-known in the region and has a very good reputation.  

Hassan applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for aluminum and glass window for his shop. This will give him more space to add new products to reply to customer needs.
 
Hassan is working very hard to expand his business and to increase the inside space to attract indoor customers. He hopes to open a big special cafe in the future that people will recommend to others.

loans.use: expand his coffee shop

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima has a business that ferries people using a tuk tuk. She has been doing this business for the past five years and she is doing great. 

This marks her second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to service the tuk tuk so that she can offer better services to her customers.    She will use the anticipated profits to buy an additional tuk tuk. She hopes to have an established transport business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair the tuk tuk

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities of beads, cords, lace and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings are a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Marivic would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of beads, lace, cords and other accesories needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marivic dreams to be able to give her child a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have other businesses. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy beads, cords, lace to resell

loans.name: Malinga

texts.en: Malinga has three children who all go to schools. She owns a hair dressing salon. She wants the loan to buy more hair products such as threads, lotions, hair dye and hair care products.  The profits from the business will be used to build a house, for which she plans in the near future.

loans.use: buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is 33 years old, married and has four children ages 2, 6, 8 and 11.  Her husband works as a glass installer. To help in raising her family, Lucille has a farm  near her house. She used to raise hogs before too.  

Lucille is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and piglets so she can start hog raising once again.  Lucille is hoping that she can make the best out of her business so she can support the needs of her children. The income from this business will be used to pay school fees and a nutritious diet for her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: One Family Group

texts.en:
Hawa is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Hawa was born in Kenema city about 30 years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has 3 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Hawa sells fresh fish and has been doing this business for many years now.

With the help of this loan, Hawa and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Hawa will use her share of the loan (800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her business.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is married to a police man and they have three children, only two of them attend schools. She sells Bitenges (ladies dresses). With the loan, she wants to buy more Bitenges to sell. With the profits, she will make more reinvestment in the same business.  In the picture, Alice is wearing a Bitenge. You can see what a Bitenge looks like.

loans.use: buy dresses to sell

loans.name: Maharaba

texts.en:
Maharaba is 34 years old. He is married and resides with his three children in Samburu, Coastal Province, Kenya. He has been involved in the grocery business for more than three years, earning approximately 200 KES per day. His wife helps him run the business. Three of his children are attending school. 

In order to improve his family’s finances, Maharaba is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruit to sell. This money will help him run the business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his children achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Raw Fish Sellers Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Raw Fish Sellers II” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sinah. Sinah is aged 26; she was born in Kenema city where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and one of her children is attending primary school. For 10 years now, Sinah has been selling fresh fish. With this loan, she will buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Yoramu

texts.en: Yoramu is 49 years old. He is a married man with seven children and all go to school. He sells various items in the business and has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, he wants to buy add more items such as soap, sugar and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more items such as soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Ilda Liceth

texts.es:
La Señora Ilda es una persona emprendedora muy dedicada a su negocio propio pulpería en su casa de habitación desde hace mas de 8 años. Actualmente vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es una venta golosinas bien surtida.
Doña Ilda el préstamo lo invirtió en el negocio en la compra de carne, refrescos, manteca y pollo. Esperando crecer más con el negocio y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Los sus sueños de Doña Ilda es en poco tiempo tener un mini súper y así tener mejores ingresos y darle a sus hijos lo mejor que es la educación.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Ilda is a very hardworking woman and is very involved in her own small restaurant business in her home, which she has had for more than 8 years.

She currently lives with her husband and her three children.  Her business is a well stocked snack shop.

Ilda will invest her loan in the business by buying meat, drinks, lard, and chicken.  She is hoping to grow her business more and thus to satisfy the needs of her customers.

One of Ilda's dreams is to soon have a small grocery store and to gain a better income and give her children the best kind of education.

Choluteca, Honduras - June, 2012

loans.use: to buy meat, drinks, lard, and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 52-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines.  She has five children. She has been in food-vending business for 26 years now. Her husband is a fisherman in their community.

Grace joined CEVI because she wants to have access to financial services offered by the organization.  At this time, Grace is requesting a loan worth PHP 12,000 to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, liquor, and other things, and also to buy fishing equipment like nets and rope for her husband's fishing venture. She believes that if she is given financial support through this loan, she can purchase additional merchandise to sell in their community. With this, she will be able to cater to the needs of her customers. 

Grace is optimistic that she can expand her business and make it more profitable and sustainable in the near future. She is also thankful to the people who are kind-hearted enough to lend their money to give support to borrowers. 

Moreover, Grace wants to make future reinvestments to earn more and thus allow her to support the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and liquor and to buy fishing equipment like nets and rope.

loans.name: Zeruya

texts.en: Zeruya is 40 years old and a widow.  She has been in the business of selling shoes for the past 16 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more shoes for sell.  She plans to use the profits from her business to buy a house and make it her home.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sell.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en: Alphonse is 29 years old. He is single. He has been selling spare parts for both bicycles and motorbikes for six years. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for the bicycles and motobikes.

loans.name: Shaaban

texts.en:
Shabaan is 29 years old. He is married and resides with his seven children in Samburu Coastal Province, Kenya. He has been running a business of purchasing groundnuts to resell for more than three years. 

In order to improve his business, Shabaan is requesting a loan of 50,000 to purchase more groundnuts to resell. By doing so, he can earn more profits to support his family. 

In the future, he would like to use the profits to expand the business and help his children attend school. Moreover, he hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Magdalena Del Rosario

texts.es:
Magdalena es una mujer de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Subtanjalla  con su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad, a quien ama y es su razón para seguir esforzándose, lamentablemente por diversas razones es madre soltera; ella siempre ha sido una persona amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante junto con su pequeño, lastimosamente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no puedo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su madre, desde hace 3 años Magdalena puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de lentes solares y monturas, ella realiza sus ventas en un mercado de su ciudad; Magdalena se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes la buscan por sus lente novedosos y buena atención.
Magdalena se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como lentes de sol y diversos tipos de monturas; de esta manera ella tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea ahorrar para ampliar su negocio y así asegurar el futuro y bienestar de su pequeño hijo, ya que desea verlo convertido en un buen profesional y en un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a 23 year old woman. She lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Subtanjalla, with her small son who is 3 years old. She loves him and he is her reason to keep going. Sadly, for various reasons she is a single mother. She has always been a friendly, hardworking and enthusiast person who gives all of her strength to continue moving forward with her small child. Unfortunately, because of the necessity to work in order to afford her expenses, she is not able to pursue a professional degree, but she would have liked to have been able to do so.     

By her own initiative and with the support of her mother, three years ago Magdelena started a small business selling sunglasses and eyeglass frames. She sells in a market in her city. Magdalena likes the work that she does and believes that her business is doing well because her clients seek her out for her novelty items and good service.  

Magdalena is very thankful for Kiva loans; thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy merchandise, like sunglasses and and different types of eyeglass frames. As a result of this purchase her business will be better stocked and will allow her to increase her sales and her income. She wants to save her profits so that she can increase her business and ensure the future and well-being of her small son. She would like to see him become a professional and a good man.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sunglasses and diverse styles of eyeglass frames.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora is smart and clever with an advanced degree.  She is a doctor.  She works as an oculist and treats eyes. She knows her work very well, and she is the best doctor in her region. Sayora has additional income from animal husbandry. 

As she is the only  breadwinner in the family, she must work hard.  Her husband went to Russia to find a job, and that’s why he can’t help to Sayora.  They have two little children, and they want to do the best for them. Their house is in bad condition, and she must to repair it. She is asking a loan to buy building materials to repair their house. She awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Dry Fish Seller Association Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Dry Fish Association” group from Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of  800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mariama is the leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a trader and the couple have three children attending primary and secondary schools. Mariama has been a businesswoman for many years now, and she sells fish. With her share of this loan, she will buy fish at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy fish at wholesale

loans.name: Ma. Angelie

texts.en: For two years now, Ma. Angelie has been raising hogs for an income. She is 26 years old and married, from Cortes, Bohol. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed. She would like to increase the number of hogs that she raises and make sure that she can also sustain the feed to fatten them. This way, she can expect a better return on investment in four months time. Ma. Angelie hopes that she can have a better life and that she can build her own house someday.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 39 años. Vive en la casa que heredó de su suegra hace 14 años, en la localidad de Yanamarca. Conformó su familia, junto a su esposo Elmer y sus dos hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con uno de ellos: Creisy. 
Desde hace 3 años se dedica a criar animales, le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues siempre está en contacto con la naturaleza. Tiene ovejas, toros y vacas, de estás últimas extrae, cada día, 5 litros de leche que comercializa en la ciudad, o si existe algún lechero de la zona se la vende a él. “La producción de leche varía, cuando comen pasto verde, aumenta la leche”, comenta Gloria. Su secreto está en la siembra de los pastos, ella misma prepara los terrenos donde cultivará la alfalfa y supervisa el tiempo exacto de corte, así el pasto no está recalentado, ni mucho menos seco. Aprovecha también sus campos de cultivo para sembrar cereales, pero en poca cantidad y los comercializa en la ciudad. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. Le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza dentro de su asociación, pues recibe el apoyo de sus integrantes, quienes velan por el bienestar de cada uno. “En cada reunión siempre aportamos las cuotas con responsabilidad”, afirma.
Gloria invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de una vaca criolla y con el resto de dinero comprará ovejas.
texts.en:
Gloria is 39 years old. She in the house that she inherited from her mother in law 14 years ago, in the Yanamarca area. Her family is made up of her husband Elmer and her two children. Now only one of them lives with her, Creisy. 

She has made a living raising animals for three years, which she likes a lot because she is always in contact with nature. She has sheep, bulls and cows. She milks the cows every day, extracting five liters of milk which she sells in the city or to another milk vendor in the area. "The production of milk varies, when they eat green grass, the milk produced increases", Gloria comments. Her secret is in the planting of the grass, she prepares the land herself where she will cultivate alfalfa and supervises at the time the grass is cut. In this way the grass is not overheated, nor too dry. She also takes advantage of her fields to sow grains in small quantities and sells them in the city. 

She belongs to the communal bank "Corazon de Jesus" and this is her fifth loan with the MFP. She likes the work a lot that is done within the association because she receives support from the members, all of whom back each other up for the well being of each one. "In each meeting, we always contribute our shares with responsibility", she affirms. 

Gloria will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of one cow and will use the rest of the money to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy a cow and some sheep.

loans.name: Adonay

texts.es: Adonay, tiene la edad 46 de  años, está casada y vive con su esposo y tres hijos. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos cerdos y además el  concentrado para el engorde de los mismos. Ella cuenta ya con el local donde va a tener los cerdos. Ella quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Adonay is 46 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children.  She hopes with the credit to complete the purchase of some pigs and also pig feed in order to fatten the animals.  She already has the space where she will keep the pigs.  She wants to have her animals at the ideal weight in order to sell them at the local market and in nearby areas.  She wants to generate the greatest amount of income possible for her well-being and that of her family as well as to grow in the project of raising pigs.  This is the first loan that she will receive from FUDECOSUR.  She has never had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan with more ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is 44 years old and married, with six children. Her eldest is 18 and the youngest is 2. Esterlita is doing her best to support her children because her husband does not earn that much from being a laborer. She produces firewood and coconut wine that she also resells to other small sari-sari (variety) stores in her community. She is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine for resale. This is also a way for her to help the coconut farmers in her community. Her income will provide a nutritious diet for her family as well as education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine for resale

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en: Nancy is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Nancy was born in Kenema city about 29 years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has 2 children – 1 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. For many years now, Nancy has been selling clothes, etc. This is the first loan that Nancy and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Nancy will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to expand her business.  She will buy clothes at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 32 years old, married and has four children who are in school. She operates her business in a busy environment with readily available customers. She has been in the business since the year 2007. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to expand her business. She has also learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management.

She dreams of opening a boutique in five years and building rental houses. She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy shirts and trousers for resale.

loans.use: to buy shirts and trousers

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 31 years old, married and has two children. He operates a cereal shop for a living. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He has also learned how to manage his finances because he has been trained in financial management.

He dreams of expanding his business and to buying a piece of land in the future. He needs a loan of 60,000 KES to open a cereal shop.

loans.use: to open a cereal shop

loans.name: Rosa Susana

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su madre, hermanos y sus 2 pequeños hijos de 2 y 6 años de edad, a quienes ama y son su razón para seguir esforzándose, ella siempre ha sido una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus pequeños, lamentablemente por diversas razones desde hace varios años se separó de su pareja; gracias al apoyo de su madre y a sus deseos por superarse, Rosa pudo estudiar la carrera de Obstetricia; en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, Rosa puso en marcha un pequeño negocio de venta de diversos productos, como ropa, productos naturales y golosinas, ella cuenta con un kiosco donde realiza sus ventas, donde dedica un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 20 clientes, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes la buscan por sus productos, precios y buena atención.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un estante, una vitrina y un poco de golosinas y productos naturales para su negocio; de esta manera Rosa podrá tener su negocio acondicionado y abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea utilizarlos para poder adquirir su casa propia y con ello cumplir su gran sueño de ejercer su carrera profesional y lograr que sus pequeños se conviertan en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 25 year old woman. She lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago, with her mother, siblings and her 2 small children who are 2 and 6 years old. She loves her children very much, they are her reason to keep going. She has always been a happy, hard working and enthusiastic person, who puts all her effort into helping her children get ahead. Sadly, for various reasons a few years ago she separated from her spouse. Thanks to the support of her mother and her personal desire to overcome she was able to study midwifery. In her spare time she likes to read and on special occasions prepare a delicious ceviche to share with her family.

As a result of her own initiative and the support of her family, Rosa was able to open a small business selling diverse products, including clothes, natural products and snacks. She has a kiosk from which she sells, working approximately 10 hours a day, assisting approximately 20 customers a day. She enjoys her work and believes that her business does well because her customers seek her out for the products she carries, for her good prices and service.  

Rosa is very thankful for Kiva loans; thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy shelves, a display case and a few snacks and natural products for her business. This will allow her to have her business in good condition and well stocked; she hopes to increase her sales, as well as her income. She wants to use her profits to buy her own home and also complete her great dream of working in the profession she studied. She wants her children to grow up to be good men.

loans.use: to buy shelves, a display case, a few snacks and natural products for her store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene 36 años. Vive en casa de sus padres, en la localidad de Justicia Paz y Vida. Junto a sus padres esperan el nacimiento de su primer hijo, tiene 8 meses de embarazo. 
Antes que comenzará con su negocio se dedicaba a la docencia, pues es profesora. Dejó de laborar por su embarazo, pero desea retomar su carrera. En su casa tenía un cuarto, ahí pensó abrir un negocio, tenía en mente muchas ideas, pero observó que en su zona no existían muchas tiendas que vendieran frutas y en la mañana sus vecinos compran frutas para el refrigerio de sus hijos en la escuela. Por eso, con un capital mínimo, abrió su negocio de venta de frutas, poco a poco los pobladores conocieron su tienda. “Durante las mañanas tengo mucha venta, mis clientes compran las frutas porque los mantengo limpias, además tengo de todos los precios y calidades”, comenta. Ahora desea comprar vitrinas para poder mostrar sus productos, como también un refrigerador para mantenerlos frescos.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Juan Bautista” y este es su primer crédito con MFP. Asegura que gracias al dinero mejorará su negocio, agradece también el apoyo que recibe de parte de su asociación, pues las personas que lo integran son personas buenas, que incentivan al progreso.
Evelyn invertirá este dinero en la compra de frutas de temporada como: piña, mandarina y plátanos, en gran cantidad, para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old.  She lives at home with her parents in the locale Justicia Paz y Vida. Together with her parents, she is awaiting the birth of her first child; she is 8 months pregnant.

Before she had started her business, she had been in the field of teaching, as she is a teacher.  She ceased work because of her pregnancy, but she wants to return to her career.  In her house she has a spare room, and there she thought to open a business.  She had been coming up with many ideas, but she noticed that in her area there are not many businesses that sell fruits, and that in the morning her neighbors buy fruit for their children's snacks at school.  Therefore, with a small amount of capital, she opened a small fruit shop, and little by little the townspeople got to know her store.

"In the mornings, I have many sales.  My customers buy the fruits because I keep them clean, and also I have all different prices and qualities," she says.  She now wants to buy glass cases to show her products and also a refrigerator to keep them fresh.

She is a member of the solidarity group “San Juan Bautista” and this is her first loan with MFP.  She is certain that, thanks to this money, she will be able to improve her business, and she is also grateful for the support she has received as a part of her association because the people involved are good people who motivate her to make progress.

Evelyn will invest this money in buying seasonal fruits like pineapples, mandarin oranges, and plantains in large quantities to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, mandarin oranges, and plantains for her shop.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuestros Inicios”  perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
El se dedica al rubro de venta de productos alimenticios, desde hace 5 años. Comenta que su mercadería la vende a su clientela desplazándose en su triciclo de puerta en puerta, trabaja de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Temuco, en supermercados y distribuidoras, ya que son lugares en los cuales encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará  ají, mostaza,  Kétchup, para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Jose es comprarse un vehículo para poder movilizarse sin problemas, evitando el frio durante la temporada de invierno y el calor durante la temporada de verano,  además cumplir con los pedidos de su clientela, que hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien y lo mantiene tranquilo.
Jose vive solo. Sus sueños son prósperar en su negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Jose está muy contento y agradecido del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómodo con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad, lo cual lo motiva a seguir participando de la institución. Comenta además que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Jose is part of the communal bank "Nuestros Inicios", in the city of Temuco. 

For the past 5 years he has worked in the sale of food products. He sells his merchandise to his clients by moving about door to door on his tricycle, Mondays through Saturdays following his own schedule and distributing according to his availability. He buys his products in the city of Temuco, from supermarkets and distributors, as these are places where he finds his merchandise at low cost and therefore it is economically convenient. With this loan he will buy pepper, mustard, and ketchup to stock his business.

One of Jose's goals is to buy himself a vehicle in order to move around without problems, avoid the cold during the winter and the heat during the summer, and to comply with all of his clients' orders, which up until now has been going very well. 

Jose lives alone. His dream is to prosper with his business, in order to generate greater income and in this way improve his quality of life.

Jose is very happy and grateful for the loan and services provided by Fondo Esperanza. Additionally, he tells us that he feels very comfortable with the meetings and communal bank group, as there is a sense of generosity and unity which serves as motivation for him to continue participating with the institution. He tells us that the trainings provided in the meetings have helped him to better invest in his business.
