For this reason, the first thing she plans to do is expand her business and acquire more merchandise so that she can serve more customers.  As she lives in an agricultural area, most people go out to work on the land and first buy their supplies from stores such as Verónica's.

This is Verónica's first loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  She has been a member of 'Los Shirokis' community bank for a short time and she says that she feels comfortable because her fellow group members are hard-working people.

Verónica will invest this money in improving her grocery store.  She will buy shelves on which she will display her products.  She will also buy merchandise such as: canned food, rice, sugar, soda, etc.

loans.use: to buy shelves for her store, as well as rice, sugar, canned food and other products

loans.name: Meliza

texts.es:
Meliza tiene 24 años, tiene un hijo de 8 años llamado Willy. Viven en una casa humilde que construyó con el apoyo de sus padres, en la comunidad nativa San Pablo de Shimashiro.
Desde que dio a luz a su hijo se hace cargo de las 3 parcelas de terrenos que la comunidad le otorgó. En ellas produce exclusivamente café. Sus cosechas son una vez al año, por eso también cuenta con un negocio que instaló en su casa, ahí vende productos de primera necesidad a los comuneros de la zona. De esa manera cubre sus gastos diarios. “Con la cosecha de café obtengo buenas ganancias. Pero debo guardar el dinero para gastos importantes para el año”, menciona. Meliza es muy responsable y sabe administrar muy bien sus ingresos, de esa manera paga a los operarios a quienes contrata con frecuencia para la limpieza, cultivo y cosecha. Ahora que ya terminó la época de cosecha se esmera en la limpieza de sus cultivos, para asegurar una mejor producción para el próximo año.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP. Siente agradecimiento por el apoyo del primer ciclo. Ahora menciona que será igual de puntual en los pagos. Por otra parte, muestra su agrado de pertenecer al banco comunal “Los Shirokis”, donde recibe charlas educativas.
Con este dinero podrá comprar bolsas de abono orgánico para su cafetal, que quedó débil después de la cosecha. Además invertirá un porcentaje en la compra de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Meliza is 24 years old. She has an 8 year old son named Willy. They live in a humble home that she built with the support of her parents in the native community of  San Pablo de Shimashiro.

Since she gave birth to her son, she has taken care of 3 parcels of land that the community granted her. There she produces coffee exclusively. She harvests once a year. That is why she also has a business that she opened  in her house. She sells basic necessity products to the community members in the area. That is how she covers her daily expenses. “With the coffee harvest I get good profits. But I have to save the money for the important yearly expenses”, she remarks. Meliza is very responsible and she knows how to manage her income very well. In this way, she pays the laborers she hires frequently for clearing, growing and harvesting. Now that the harvest is over, she is working on clearing her crops to ensure better production for next year. 

This is her second loan with MFP. She feels grateful for the support fron the first cycle. Now she says she will be just as punctual with her payments. On the other hand, she is pleased to beling to the “Los Shirokis” communal bank, where she goes to educational talks.

With this money, she will be able to buy sacks of organic fertilizer for her coffee planting. She will also invest a percentage in buying merchandise for her small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee planting and some products for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; la socia tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 03 hijos la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan,  a la vez la socia se dedica a la ganadería y  venta de verduras como zanahorias,cebollas,zapallo entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de zanahorias y cebollas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'Ima Sucac Suncco' community bank which is located in Cusco province and department.

The member is Alejandrina.  She is 38 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She raises these animals and then sells them to customers who request them.  She is also in the cattle business and sells vegetables such as carrots, onions, squashes, etc.  She has been in her business for a long time and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day.  This is how she provides for her family.

Alejandrina is requesting this loan to buy carrots and onions.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy carrots and onions

loans.name: Denis Antonio

texts.es: Denis Antonio de  54 años de edad soltero con tres hijos menores este emprendedor tiene por actividad  económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 4 años , el negocio consisten en verde productos de consumo diario como: granos básicos, pollo en piezas, gaseosas, verduras, tiste, pan, leche, galletas, entre otros, el negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo para sacar adelante a su hijo, en la actualidad gracias a  su tenacidad y responsabilidad y el apoyo que fundación y el programa kiva le brinda a los pequeños comerciantes es que ha podido cumplir sueños y metas personales como ampliar su negocio, mejorar sus vivienda, y formar a su hijo con sus
texts.en:
Denis Antonio is 54 years old, single, with three young children. This entrepreneur has had as his economic activity a grocery store located in his home for 4 years. The business consists of natural products of consumption such as basic grains, chicken pieces, soft drinks, vegetables, tiste (a drink made from either rice or corn with cocoa), bread, milk, cookies and other items.

The business came about through the necessity of having a working tool in order to provide for his son. Thanks to his tenacity and responsibility and the help that the foundation and the Kiva program have given the small retailers he has been able to fulfill dreams and personal goals such as expanding his business, improving his housing, and educating his son.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, chicken pieces, soft drinks, vegetables, tiste (drink made from rice or corn and cocoa) bread, milk, cookies and others

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina tiene 29 años, su pareja es David, con quien tiene dos hijos de 10 y 4 años. Ellos viven juntos en una casita rústica que David construyó hace 10 años y se ubica en la comunidad nativa San Pablo de Shimashiro (selva central).

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, posee seis cuadras de terrenos que adquirió por medio de la comunidad. Ahí produce café y kión. La mayor parte de sus cosechas la negocia en la ciudad, que se ubica a una hora y media desde su comunidad. Lleva más de 10 años en esta actividad, al lado de su pareja y le agrada porque su esfuerzo se ve reflejado en las ganancias que obtiene de cada venta. De esa manera, mantiene a su familia, por ello ahora quiere mejorar sus frutos y extender sus cultivos. Estos meses tiene que darle prioridad al cultivo de kión, ya que culminó hace poco con la cosecha de café.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se siente comprometida de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Shirokis” del que se siente a gusto.
Destinará el dinero de este préstamo en el pago de jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos de kión.
texts.en:
Justina is 29 years old and her partner is David.  The couple have two children who are 10 and 4 years old.  They live together in a house made from rustic materials that David built 10 years ago.  It is located in the indigenous community of San Pablo de Shimashiro (in the central Peruvian jungle).

Justina is a farmer.  She has six 'cuadras' of land that she acquired through her community where she grows coffee and ginger.  She sells most of her harvested crops in the city which is one and a half hours from her community.  She has been in this business for 10 years, alongside her partner, and she enjoys it because she can see her hard work reflected in the profits that she makes whenever she sells her crops.  This is how she provides for her family.  Right now she would like to improve and extend her crops.  Over the coming months she has to give priority to looking after her ginger crops because she recently finished harvesting her coffee.

This is Justina's first loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She belongs to 'Los Shirokis' community bank and feels very happy to be a member.  She will use her loan money to pay the laborers who she will hire to weed her ginger crops.

loans.use: to pay laborers who will work on her land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes, belts, shoes etc.

loans.name: Washe

texts.en:
Washe, who lives in the Changamwe area of Coast province, is married and has seven children, three of whom attend school. The owner and operator of a retail shop for five years now, he also earns income through farming. His major challenges are high prices for goods and fuel.

Washe learned about Milango through a friend and is now requesting a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy maize flour, sugar and cereals for his shop. The extra income arising from the loan will be added to savings to expand the business and pay school fees. His future plan is to expand the business into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar and cereals for the business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is an artisan who specializes in hand-carved wood masks, mirror frames and sculptures. She would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as wood and paints.

Rita has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is her story:

As an artist, Rita proudly includes African themes in her designs. "Having a passion for creating more designs inspires me, and I have taught this art to a number of people. The basic materials I use are sese wood and aluminum sheets. My favorite things in life are cooking and being with my family. I dream that we'll one day have enough so I can also give back to others."

"I would like to thank you very much for assisting me through this interest-free microcredit. It will improve my production, which eventually will mean better sales for me, hence enabling me to cover my daughter's school fees."

Use the link below to view Rita's masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7110

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as wood and paints

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional grocery products to sell in her store.

NWTF is presenting Jonalyn's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy additional grocery products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku is an artisan who specializes in masks and wood carvings. He would like to purchase the raw materials he needs to continue production.

Kwaku has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I studied business and worked for many years in the field, but I wasn't satisfied. In 1984, I was introduced to the carving profession by my cousin, who was a carver and also a professional teacher. He taught me how to carve for about a year, and it seemed to come naturally to me. I then started a full-time professional carving career late in 1985. I have been carving on my own ever since. I have since learned how to decorate my works with brass and beads, making them unique."

"I'd like to say thank you for your support. This loan will allow me to have the materials I need to work continuously and create more designs."

Use the link below to view Kwaku's masks and wood carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=2392

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as wood, brass and beads

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia sigue dedicándose a su tienda de Abarrotes, el cual le va muy bien, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para capitalizar su actividad y comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche etc. para surtir su comercio.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member is a part of the community bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” from the city of Cusco, Perú.  She continues to dedicate herself to her grocery store, which is going really well, and this activity permits her to help her family get ahead.  For this reason, she will invest to asked for loan to gain capital for her activities and to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc. to stock her store.

She is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to sustain herself in her business and for helping her family.

She thanks the lenders and promises to complete the payment of her loan installments according to her payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy items like rice, sugar, milk, and noodles wholesale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira, 53 years of age, is looking to take a new loan with Edpyme and Kiva following the success of the previous one. Her punctuality and responsibility have earned her the right to access a new loan. Elvira lives with her husband and children in her own home. It has only electrical service and is located in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo in Northern Peru. This zone is characterized by its commercial, agricultural and livestock activities.

For several years, Elvira has dedicated herself to raising and selling sheep. Indeed, this was the focus of her previous loan. Her corral is located outside her house and is appropriate and ample. She gives her sheep balanced feed and natural grasses for optimal growth to commercialize them. Elvira has now requested a loan of 4,000 PEN (soles) from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and their feed and a mototaxi, which she believes will help her transport merchandise and perhaps diversify her income. With the income she obtains, she will cover needed improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their feed and a mototaxi, to transport merchandise and diversify her income.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuyes para su negocio. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member is a part of the community bank “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO.”  The bank is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Vilma, and she spends her days in the business of raising small animals likes guinea pigs and chickens.  She raises the little animals to sell to customers who wants them, and she has spent a lot of time in this line of work, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into every day at her job.  In this way, the group member helps out her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

She is very happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is from Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Alicia is married and has four children. 

To make a living, she manages a business buying and selling fish and crabs. She has been in her business for 14 years and earns 4000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2010, Alicia joined GDMPC. Alicia is requesting a loan of 4700 PHP to buy additional fish and crabs to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and crabs to sell.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ella requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

She has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Ella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Jessilyn

texts.en:
Jessilyn is married with 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jessilyn is 33 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

Jessilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jessilyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing net and a new engine for her fishing boat.

Jessilyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jessilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
For over eight years in Riverside, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Judith, a 24-year-old married mother of 2 children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Judith joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Doris, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia sigue dedicándose a su restaurante, el cual le va muy bien, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por ello inviertirá el préstamo solicitado para capitalizar su actividad y comprar mercadería e insumos para su comercio de alimentos.
Doris está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
Doris agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
The group member is Doris, who is a member of the community bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” from the city of Cusco, Perú.  She continues to work in her restaurant, which is doing well, and this activity helps her family to get ahead.  She will invest her asked for loan in her business and buy merchandise and comestibles for her food sales business.

Doris is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to maintain her business and support her family.

Doris thanks and values the lender and promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, bags of sugar, noodles, and oil.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Julife

texts.en: Julife is from Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Julife is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Julife owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products and seafood products like fish and shrimp in the local community. Julife has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Julife joined GDMPC. Julife is requesting new loan of 5,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Maribel Antonia

texts.es: Maribel Antonia de 40 años de edad del municipio de Chinandega, soltera con un hijo, tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, tiempo de tener el negocio 4 años, el negocio consisten en la compra de ropa variada como: pantalones, camisas, short, camisetas, calcetines, toallas, sabanas, vestidos, entre otros.
texts.en: Maribel Antonia is forty years old and from the municipality of Chinandega.  She is single with one child.  As her work she sells general merchandise and has had this business for the past four years.  The business consists of buying a variety of clothing items like pants, shirt,s shorts, blouses, socks, towels, sheets, and dresses, among others.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, socks, towels, sheets, and dresses, among other items.

loans.name: Virginia Alejandra

texts.es:
Doña Virginia tiene la edad de 50 años, madre soltera, comerciante en venta de ropa y cosméticos, para ella ah sido difícil, ya que le ha tocado trabajar para salir adelante con su familia. Las mejora  a su casa, no los hechos para cubrir los gastos personales y básicos del hogar. 
Hoy en día sus dos hijos trabajan,  y la apoyan. Su pequeña casa es sencilla y ya muy deteriorada, lo que comenzara hacer en concreto, haciendo el arranque, hasta donde alcance los materiales, siendo posible con financiamiento en Afodenic, y que espera avanzar en corto plazo, para una vivienda segura y digna.
texts.en:
Virginia is fifty years old, a single mother, and a saleswoman of clothing and cosmetics.  For her it has been difficult, since she has had to work hard to help her family succeed.  Improvements to her house have not been done because she has had to cover her personal expenses and the household necessities.

Now her two children work and help support her.  Her little house is plain and very deteriorated, she will begin to rebuild it out of concrete, starting it when she can get the materials.  This will be possible with the financing of Afodenic, and she hopes to proceed in a short time to have a secure and dignified home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to begin building her concrete block house.

loans.name: Fanny Del Carmen

texts.es: Fanny dentro de algunos años le gustaría tener su propio negocio, su carrera le ayudará a tener una mejor visión, está estudiando el último año de la carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas y el crédito será usado para el pago de finalización de estudios. Su tía le ha inspirado para salir adelante, es una persona luchadora y ha salido adelante con mucho esfuerzo. estaba estudiando dos carreras, pero por falta de recursos tuvo que dejar de estudiar una y continuará con la siguiente.
texts.en: Fanny, in a few years, would like to have her own business.  Her professional studies will help her to have a better vision, and she is studying in her final year in Systems Engineering and her loan will be used to finance her studies.  Her aunt has inspired her to get ahead; she is a real fighter and she has gotten ahead with a great deal of strength.  She was studying a double major, but because of her lack of funds she had to drop one but will continue with the other.

loans.use: to pay for her professional certification coursework.

loans.name: Tp Takku  Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 04 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Septembre 2007. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.
Madame Monique (assise à  droite sur la photo) est l’emprunteuse vedette,  âgée de 72 ans, elle est Veuve et mère de 05 enfants 02 garçons et 3 filles).

Elle achète et vend des légumes, une activité qu’elle pratique depuis  1997.
Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 25 caisses de tomate dans les régions de l’ouest et du centre ouest à pour les revendre au central.

-	Pour une caisse de Tomate farcie à 12 000F Cfa
-	Transport 1 500F Cfa/caisse
-	Frais de facilitateur au marché 200F Cfa/caisse 
-	Prix de vente d’une caisse 18 000F Cfa
Donc après déduction des charges variables liées à la vente estimée à 300F Cfa par caisse elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice net de  4000F Cfa par caisse.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et de continuer la construction de maison et la prise en charge de la scolarité des ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group comprises four women who are very active in the local village loan group created in September 2007. They all come from the same area and have good relationships with each other. Their main activity is running small businesses.
Ms. Monique (sitting on the right in the photo) is the star borrower - she is a 72-year-old widowed mother of five children: two sons and three daughters.
She sells and buys vegetables, a business she has run since 1997.
With this loan, she intends to buy 25 crates of tomatoes in the western and central-western regions to sell in the central region. The breakdown is as follows:
- 12,000 FCFA paid per crate stuffed with tomatoes
- 1,500 FCFA paid per crate for transportation
- 200 FCFA paid per crate for market facilitation fees
- 18,000 FCFA earned from selling one crate
Thus, after subtracting the additional variable sales-related costs, estimated at 300 FCFA per crate, she finds herself with a net profit of 4,000 FCFA per crate.

The profits from her business will allow her to save money, continue the construction of her house, and take charge of her children's education.

loans.use: To buy 25 crates of tomatoes in the western and central-western regions for sale in the central region.

loans.name: Tp Takku  Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
C e groupe est composé de 04 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Septembre 2007. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ramatoulaye  (debout à droite avec la main  droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette, âgée de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants (4 Garçons et 2 filles).
Elle vend des céréales locales. Activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de 20 ans.
Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en céréales : une tonne de mil et une demie tonne de maïs dans les marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants.

-	Pour 10 kg de mil acheté à 1150F Cfa, les frais de transport et de manutention s’élèvent à 300F Cfa, elle revend à 1850F Cfa la même quantité.
-	Apres déduction des charges variables (stockage, sachet plastique …) elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice net de 350 f Cfa/10 kg.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et  de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge alimentaire et scolaire.
texts.en:
This group comprises four women who are very active in the local village loan fund, created in September 2007. They all come from the same area and have good relationships with each other. Their main activity is running small businesses.

Ms. Ramatoulaye (standing on the right with her right hand raised) is the star borrower - she is a 54-year-old married mother of six children (four sons and two daughters).
She sells local cereals. She has run this business for more than 20 years.
With this loan, she intends to obtain supplies of cereals - one tonne of millet and one half-ton of maize - from the weekly markets in the neighbouring towns. The breakdown is as follows:
- For 10 kg of millet purchased at 1150 FCFA, the transportation and handling costs come to 300 FCFA, and she re-sells this amount for 1850 FCFA.
- After subtracting various additional charges (stocking, plastic bags, etc.), she finds herself with a net profit of 350 FCFA per 10 kg.

The profits from her business will allow her to save money and support her husband in providing for the family's nutritional and educational needs.

loans.use: To obtain supplies of cereals - one tonne of millet and one half-tonne of maize - at the weekly markets in the neighbouring towns.

loans.name: Tp Takku  Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 31 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Septembre 2007. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aïssatou (assise à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette,  âgée de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02  garçons. Elle achète et vend des produits alimentaires comme le sucre, l’huile …, une activité qu’elle fait depuis 3 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en caisse de cuisse de poulet dans la sous région pour la revente au marché central.
-	Pour une caisse de cuisse de poulet à 12 000F Cfa  elle revende à 24 000F Cfa.
-	Pour un sac de sucre de 24 000F Cfa elle revend à 30 000F Cfa
-	Pour un bidon de 20 litres d’huile à 14 500F Cfa elle revend à 19 000f Cfa
-	Pour un carton 12 pots de 1 kg de tomate à 18 000 F Cfa elle revend à 23 500F Cfa
Apres vente et déduction des frais de manutention et de location de cantine elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice net hebdomadaire de 20 000F Cfa. 

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et de prendre en charge un partie de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group comprises 31 women who are very active in the local village loan fund, created in September 2007. They all come from the same area and have good relationships with each other. Their main activity is running small businesses.

Ms. Aïssatou (sitting all the way on the right) is the featured borrower. She is a 34-year-old married mother of two sons. She buys and sells food products such as sugar, oil, etc. She has run this business for three years.

With this loan, she intends to purchase crates of chicken thighs in the sub-region and re-sell them at the central market. The breakdown is as follows:
- Each crate of chicken thighs costs 12,000 FCFA and will be sold for 24,000 FCFA
- Each bag of sugar costs 24,000 FCFA and will be sold for 30,000 FCFA
- Each 20-litre can of oil costs 14,500 FCFA and will be sold for 19,000 FCFA
- Each box consisting of twelve 1-kg pots of tomatoes costs 18,000 FCFA and will be sold for 23,500 FCFA

After selling these items and subtracting the fees for handling and renting space, she finds herself with a weekly net profit of 20,000 FCFA.

The profits from her business will allow her to save money and take care of a portion of her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase crates of chicken thighs in the sub-region for resale at the central market.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 53 years old and married with 8 children.

Consolacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, and other grocery products.

Consolacion has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 2 years and also earns some money from food vending.

Consolacion aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, and other grocery products

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 43 years old and married with 5 children.

Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items for her general store.

Marites has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Marites aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her general store

loans.name: Narcie

texts.en:
Narcie is 37 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Narcie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Narcie has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from dressmaking.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plantain seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is 56 years old and married with 2 children.

Nonita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rock salt retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of salt to sell.

Nonita has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been selling rock salt for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nonita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of salt to sell

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 40 years old and married with 4 children.

Rosalia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Rosalia has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for a year and also earns an income from fishing.

Rosalia aspires to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tp Takku  Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 37 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Septembre 2007. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fall yaye (accroupie en première rangée à gauche et en médaillon à droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette,  âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04  enfants (1 Garçon et 3 filles).
Elle a une place au marché ou elle vend le petit déjeuné et des légumes la journée, elle a une expérience de 12 ans dans ce domaine.

Avec ce prêt elle compte renforcer son commerce par l’achat en quantité des légumes et autres produits entrant dans la préparation des petits afin de maximiser sa marge bénéficiaire.
-	Pour une dépense de 15 000F Cfa par jour pour préparer les différents plats pour le petit déjeuné, elle s’en sort avec un bénéfice net journalier de 4000F Cfa 
-	Pour un sac de manioc à 17 000F Cfa elle revend en détaille à 21 000F Cfa
-	Pour un sac de d’aubergine à 7000 F elle revend à 11 000F Cfa.
Apres chaque journée après déduction de ses charges liées à son commerce elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice net de 7 000F Cfa en moyenne par jour.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et de soutenir son marie à la maison.
texts.en:
This group comprises 37 women who are very active in the local village loan fund, created in September 2007. They all come from the same area and have good relationships with each other. Their main activity is running small businesses.

Ms. Fall Yaye (squatting on the left in the first row and in the inset on the right), is the featured borrower. She is a 53-year-old married mother of four children (one son and three daughters).

She has a place in the market where she sells breakfast and vegetables during the day, and she has 12 years of experience in this business.

With this loan, she intends to strengthen her business by buying bulk quantities of vegetables and other products used to prepare ready-to-eat breakfasts in order to maximize her profit margin. The breakdown is as follows:
- After spending 15,000 FCFA per day to prepare various breakfast dishes, she leaves with a daily net profit of 4,000 FCFA.
- Each bag of manioc costs 17,000 FCFA and is resold at retail for 21,000 FCFA
- Each bag of aubergine costs 7,000 FCFA and is resold for 11,000 FCFA

At the end of each day, after subtracting business-related expenses, she finds herself with an average net profit of 7,000 FCFA per day.

The profits from her business will allow her to save money and support her husband at home.

loans.use: To strengthen her business by buying in bulk vegetables and other items used to prepare ready-to-eat breakfasts, in order to maximize her profit margin.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is from Riverside, Bonifacio. She is 37 years old. Juvy is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Juvy runs a general store and sells a variety of food and home use products in her local community. Juvy has been in this business for 13 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Juvy is requesting a loan of 4,700 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Juvy joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 55 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Adela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Adela has been raising livestock for 6 years and also earns some additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria tiene 56 años. Vive con su hijo de 20 años en su casa propia, la que construyó en su juventud al lado del padre de su hijo. Su vivienda se ubica en el anexo agrícola de Huaracayo, Tarma.
Desde hace 15 años es una mujer independiente. Gracias a los terrenos que heredó de sus padres produce arvejas, maíz, papas, lechugas y otros. Además posee cuatro vacas, ocho carneros y animales menores como cuyes; los que cría y después de unos meses comercializa. Pero la actividad que más satisfacciones le da es la venta de leche. “Tengo tres vacas que son lecheras, y el negocio es de todos los días por eso no descuido a mis animales en su alimentación”, menciona. Con estas actividades ha logrado educar a su único hijo, quién la apoya en las labores del campo, específicamente en la siembra y cultivo de sus sembríos. Ahora tiene sembrado tres parcelas de arvejas que piensa cosechar en agosto. Cada parcela le arrojará como mínimo 20 sacos de 60 kilos. Una de sus metas es sembrar alfalfa para alimentar a sus animales y para venderla a otros ganaderos. 

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por eso se siente comprometida en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá adquirir semillas de alfalfa para iniciar una siembra de pastos para la alimentación de sus animales.
texts.en:
Silveria is 56 years old.  She lives with her 20 year old son in her own hosue, she built in her youth alongside the father of her son.  Her home is located in the annexed agriculturallands of Huaracayo, Tarma.

For the last 15 years she has been an independent woman.  Thanks to the land that she inherited from her parents, she produces peas, corn, potatoes, lettuce, and other vegetables.  She laso owns four cows, eight rams and small domestic animals like guinea pigs, which she raises and sells after a few months.  Yet the activity which she most enjoys is the sale of milk.  "I have three cows that produce milk, and the business runs every day, so I never forget to feed and care for my animals," she says.  With these activities, she has successfully educated her only son, who helps her in her work in the fields, especially during the planting and cultivation of her crops.  She currently has three parcels of land planted in peas, which she thinks she will harvest in August.  Each parcel will produce at least 20 sacks of 60 kilos each.  One of her goals is to plant alfalfa to feed her animals and to sell to other ranchers.

This is her third loan with MFP, and therefore she feels certain to pay her monthly loans payments punctually.

With the money from her loan, she will be able to acquire alfalfa seeds to begin planting pasture land for the feeding of her animals

loans.use: to buy seeds to cultivate the pastures for her animals.

loans.name: Diambars De Doumassou Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré le 13 décembre 2011 le banc villageois de Diambars de Doumassou est au deuxième cycle. Les membres sont très dynamiques et font preuve d’un esprit de groupe dans toute situation. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (assise à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle veuve et prend en charge quatre de ses filles. Elle est vendeuse de crème glacée et divers jus de fruit à l’école privé de son quartier. Cette activité, elle l’a pratique depuis plus d’une décennie. Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 02 sacs de pain de singe et un demi-sac de sucre et les autres ingrédients afin de pour travailler sur une période sans arrêt pour cause de manque de fonds de roulement. 

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront de mieux s’occuper de sa famille tant sur le plan de la nourriture et autres besoins vitaux.
texts.en:
Inaugurated on 13 December 2011, the Diambars village loan group of Doumassou is on its second cycle. The members are very dynamic and display their group spirit in all situations. Their main activity is running small businesses.

Ms. Mariama (sitting all the way on the right) is the featured borrower. She is a widow and takes care of four of her daughters. She is a retailer of ice cream and various fruit juices at the private school in her area. She has run this business for over a decade. With this loan, she intends to buy two bags of monkey bread, one half-bag of sugar, and other ingredients in order to work continuously because of a lack of working capital.

The profits from this business will allow her to better provide for her family, both in terms of nutrition and other essential needs.

loans.use: To buy two bags of monkey bread, one half-bag of sugar, and other ingredients in order to work continuously due to a lack of working capital.

loans.name: Elbinida

texts.en:
Elbinida is 47 years old and widowed with one child. She works very hard to provide for her child.

Elbinida runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Elbinida has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, sugar, soap, etc. 

In the future, Elbinida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and has one child. She is 31 years old and resides at Poblacion, Bonifacio, Philippines. 

Susan owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She has been five years in this business. 

Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

In 2010, Susan joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Basilides

texts.en:
Basilides is married and has four children. She is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Basilides is a farmer and she operates a corn production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for thirteen years and every month she earns PHP 4,500 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

Basilides has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, she hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.es:
Rubí tiene 25 años, su pareja es Nino, con quien tiene una hija de 7 meses de nacida. Los tres viven en su casa propia, la que ellos mismos construyeron y se ubica en la comunidad nativa Santa Teresa (selva central).
Hace 7 años que empezó a trabajar en el campo, la agricultura es su actividad económica. Ella y Nino ahora cuentan con seis cuadras de terrenos que la comunidad les otorgó. En ellas produce café, yuca y achiote. “En abril, mayo y junio cosecho mis tres productos, por eso en esos días no me falta dinero y puedo cubrir mis deudas”, menciona. Además cuenta con una cultura de ahorro que el permite abastecer sus gastos para todo el año. Por su parte, su pareja también trabaja como jornalero en otras parcelas, así obtiene ingresos para pagar algún gasto eventual. Ahora acaba de cosechar y vender los últimos granos de café, por eso iniciará con la limpieza y con el mantenimiento de sus plantas, para ello comprará bolsas de abono orgánico.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP. Se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales y agradece la confianza y el apoyo dentro de su banco comunal “Los Ompicres”. 
Con este dinero podrá comprar bolsas de abono, cuyo precio asciende a los 160 soles por saco de 60 kilos. Comprará alrededor de nueve sacos para su cafetal.
texts.en:
Rubi is 25 years old and her life partner is Nino, with whom she has a daughter aged 7 months. The 3 live in their own house which they themselves constructed in the native community of Santa Teresa in the central forest.

Seven years ago she began working in agriculture in the countryside. Rubi and Nino now have 6 plots of land assigned to them by the community. In these they produce coffee, manioc, and annata. “In April, May and June, I harvest my 3 products; so, in those days I do not lack money and I can cover my debts,” Rubi comments. In addition, she can count on a culture of saving that permits her to cover expenses all year. For his part, her husband works as a day laborer on other parcels of land, thus obtaining income to pay some of their inevitable expenses. Rubi has just finished the harvest and sale of the final grains of coffee. For this reason, she will begin cleaning the land and maintaining their plants. For that reason, she needs to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

This is her 2nd loan through MFP. Rubi promises to be punctual in her monthly payments and she is grateful for the confidence and the help from her communal bank, “Los Ompicres”. With this money Rubi will be able to buy bags of fertilizer, whose price can be as high as 160 new sols per 60-kilo sack. She will purchase around 9 sacks for her coffee fields.

loans.use: buy 9 sacks of organic fertilizer for her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en:
Toem is 39 years old and a resident of Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She became a mother of three children who all are attending school and still are in need of her daily allowances. 

To support her children’s education, Toem and her spouse help each other in maintaining their farm work. They grow rice, potatoes, and beans for sale each cropping season. At the same time, Toem also devotes her spare time to a fruit selling business, which has been operating in a local market of her community.

In order to make her business more viable, Toem would like to take out a loan in the sum of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase a used motorcycle, which will be used to support her in her business. It will be easier for her to get access to the marketplace. It will take part in developing a better business and make it more profitable in the future. 

She wishes to educate her three children at a minimum of high school level.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle which will be used to support her in her fruits and vegetables selling business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is separated and has one child. She is 57 years old and resides at Centru Napo, Tudela, Philippines. Rebecca owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she has been in this business for 26 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offerings. In 2011, Rebecca joined GDMPC. In the future, Rebecca wants to build a house and to finish supporting the study of her child.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Chhean's Group

texts.en:
Not much different from other remote areas, Sangke District of Battambang province is the place in which rice farming is one of the common businesses for other villagers as well as for Chhean's family. 

Chhean is a mother of three children who are still under her responsibility. She has been growing rice for fifteen years as the main source of income and she also raises pigs for selling as the extra income. 

This is the third loan for Chhean. The first two loans, which she completely repaid, have made a better living for her family. 

Now she leads a group with three other members to request a new loan. Her requested loan amount is 500,000 KHR and she is going to use some portion of her loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for farmland and the remaining for pig feed. 

She hopes not only to improve her lifestyle, but also to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pig feed.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from Migpange, Bonifacio. She is 37 years old. Emma is married and has three children. 

To make a living, she manages a fishpond where she raises fish, crabs, and shrimp for sale. She has been engaged in her business for fifteen years and earns PHP 10,000 a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Emma joined GDMPC. Emma is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000, which will be used to buy young fish to raise and twine in order to expand the business. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy young fish to raise and twine to expand the business.

loans.name: Husniya

texts.ru: Хусния сельская женщина в возрасте  57 лет,замужем,имеет 2 детей.У нее высшее образование.Она работает директором в государственном учреждении в своем районе.Ее заработная плата очень маленькая поэтому кроме работы она дома выращивает скот.Более 20 лет занимается этим.В наличие имеет 17 поголовья скота.Она очень хорошо разбирается в сфере скотоводства.По бизнесу помогает ей ее муж.Он перепродает скот на скотном рынке,так как основной доход семьи от скотоводства.С 2010 года она кредитуется в нашей организации.Ни разу не нарушала политику кредитования.Очень ответственная,добросовестная женщина.На полученный кредит хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить свой бизнес. Она благодарна нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Husniya is a 57-year old woman living in a village. She is married, with two children. She is a college graduate. She works as director of a state agency in her district. Her salary is very low, which is why, in addition to her regular work, she also grows livestock by her house. She has been doing this for over 20 years. She has 17 heads of livestock. She is very knowledgeable in this area. Her husband helps her in his business. He sells livestock at the livestock market, since this is the family's main source of income. Husniya has been taking out loans with our organization since 2010. She never violated loan terms. She is  a very responsible, conscientious woman. She would like to use her credit to increase her livestock and expand her business. She thanks our organization for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is from Dimalco Bonifacio. She is 41 years old and married with 3 children. Teresita plants, harvests and sells corn for a living. She has been involved in her business for 13 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Teresita joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC. Teresita is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Anelita

texts.en: Anelita is married, 42 years old, with 2 kids living with her. She lives in San Apolinario, Tangub City. She sells different kinds of vegetables like eggplant, string beans, and pumpkins to earn a living and has been in this business for 17 years. Each month she earns Php 5,000 doing this type of activity. She requested a loan in the amount of Php 7,000 to purchase more vegetables to sell. Anelita has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Anelita is wishing that her business will prosper and plans to buy a motorcycle for vegetable delivery.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Bougnadou Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  est créé le 12 Décembre 2011 au jour de son inauguration. Composé actuellement de 21 femmes qui sont très solidaires, elles vivent toutes dans le même village. Elles pratiquent dans leur majorité le petit commerce. 

Madame Fatoumata  (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est âgée de 20 ans, est mariée sans enfant. Elle gère une boutique dans le village, avec ce prêt elle va acheter 03 sacs de riz à 13 500 FCFA et un sac de sucre à 30 000. Le prix de vente de ces produits est respectivement de 360 et 650 FCFA le kilogramme.

Ce nouveau prêt va lui permettre d’acheter en quantité ainsi réduire les frais de transport liés aux déplacements répétitifs.

Les bénéfices qui découleront de ses activités lui permettront en plus d’accroître son épargne dans la perspective d’avoir un crédit plus considérable, d’améliorer sa capacité de financement et ses conditions de vie.
texts.en: This [group] has been created on December 12, 2011, the day the local banc villageois was opened. The group is now composed of 21 women who have a strong sense of solidarity and all live in the same village. Most of them work as vendors. Mrs. Fatoumata (seated on the far right raising her right hand) is a star borrower. She is 20 years old and married, without children. She manages a store in the village. With this loan, she will buy three bags of rice at 13,500 West African francs and a bag of sugar at 30,000 francs. The resale price of these products is 360 and 650 West African francs per kilogram, respectively. This new loan will allow her to purchase in high quantity and thus save on the cost of multiple trips. The revenues derived from her business will allow her to build up her savings, with the future goal of getting bigger loans, being able to better finance her business and  improving her life conditions.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice at 13,500 West African francs and a bag of sugar at 30,000 francs.

loans.name: Roeurb's Group

texts.en:
Roeurb, a 37-year-old mother, lives in a remote village of the Thmor Koul District in Battambang Province. She has four dependent children. Two of her children are still in school, and one child is too young for school. Unfortunately, one of her children has a mental problem and needs serious support.
Roeurb and her husband have been struggling to farm rice on one-and-a-half hectares of farmland for their children's sake, and they have been involved in this business for 10 years. The main challenge for her family is the low crop yield caused by drought.
Roeurb and her group member have belonged to VisionFund for four loan cycles. Roeurb has used her past loans successfully to maintain her household, as well as her business. She, as a group leader, is seeking a loan of 600,000 KHR, while her group member is applying for 400,000 KHR.
Roeurb will use her portion of the loan to pay for plowing of her rice farm and to buy a cast net for catching fish to sell for additional income. She hopes to receive a higher crop yield this year in order to earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for plowing of her rice farm and to buy a cast net for catching fish to sell.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 37 years old and married with 4 children.

Emelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Emelyn has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Emelyn aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.
